blanditer: <entryFree id="n5457" type="main" key="blandi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. blandus <sense id="n5457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
blanditia: <entryFree id="n5458" type="main" key="blandi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, in <case>abl.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 11</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>blandus</etym>. <sense id="n5458.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The quality of one</hi> blandus; <hi rend="ital">a caressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi> (mostly in an honorable sense; cf. on the contrary, assentatio and adulatio; class in prose and poetry; <cb n="BLAN" /> most freq. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n5458.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec meretrix meum erum blanditiā intulit in pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscus merus vostra'st blanditia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cive excelso atque homine nobili blanditiam, ostentationem, ambitionem notam esse levitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 194, 27</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nullam in amicitiā pestem esse majorem quam adulationem, blanditiam, adsentationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursatio et blanditia popularis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:41" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:16 al" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 16 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n5458.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatteries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blandishments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allurements</hi>, = blandimenta: puerique parentum blanditiis facile ingenium fregere superbum, <hi rend="ital">caresses</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1018</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot illic (sc. in amore) blanditiae, quot illic iracundiae sunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut blanditiis suis suam voluptatem expleat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (benevolentiam civium) blanditiis et adsentando conligere turpe est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum apud te ejus blanditiae flagitiosae voluerunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditates... malitiosis blanditiis quaesitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 18, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiis ab aliquo aliquid exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum factum purgantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verniles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53 al.</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:91" default="NO">1, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:71" default="NO">1, 4, 71</bibl>; 1, 9, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 531</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 626</bibl>; 6, 632; 6, 685; 7, 817; 10, 259; 12, 407; 14, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5458.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allurement</hi> (cf. blandus, II. A., and blandior, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deliniti atque corrupti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: attrita cotidiano actu forensi ingenia optime rerum talium blanditia (i. e. lectione poëtarum) reparantur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blandities: <entryFree id="n5459" type="main" key="blandities"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandities</orth>, v. blanditia.</entryFree>
blanditim: <entryFree id="n5460" type="hapax" key="blandi_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>blanditus, from blandior</etym>, <sense id="n5460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caressing manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blanditor: <entryFree id="n5461" type="main" key="blandi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>blandior</etym>, <sense id="n5461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi> (late Lat.), Itin. Alex. M. 39 (90).</sense></entryFree>
blanditus: <entryFree id="n5462" type="main" key="blandi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>blandior</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
blandulus: <entryFree id="n5463" type="hapax" key="blandu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [blandus], <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>: animula vagula, blandula, Hadrian. Carm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blandus: <entryFree id="n5464" type="main" key="blandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for mlandus; akin to <foreign lang="greek">mei/lixos</foreign>, mollis, mulier; Goth. milds; Engl. mild</etym>, <sense id="n5464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a smooth tongue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caressing</hi> (class and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n5464.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda es parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemini credo qui large blandu'st dives pauperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unus omnium homo te vivat numquam quisquam blandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis me minime esse blandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum te puto minus blandum esse quam me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandum amicum a vero secernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alcibiades) affabilis, blandus, temporibus callidissime inserviens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an blandiores (mulieres) in publico quam in privato et alienis quam vestris estis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum neque subjectus solito nec blandior esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulorum blanda propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:999" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 999</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 604</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO">11, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:72 al" default="NO">11, 3, 72 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5464.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> constr. </sense><sense id="n5464.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">precum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 237</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5464.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas vocemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 155</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5464.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandum et auritas fidibus canoris Ducere quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:456" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 456</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5464.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus implorat. .doctā prece blandus ( = blande supplicans dis carmine quod poëta eum docuit. Orell. ad loc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5464.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly of things). </sense><sense id="n5464.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alluring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seductive</hi> (cf. blandior, II. B.; blanditia, II.): blandā voce vocare, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 51 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne blandā aut supplici oratione fallamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 642</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 575</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:375" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 375</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 156: os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:555" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 555</bibl></cit>: pectus, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 515</bibl>.—So, voluptas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 966</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1081" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1081</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1259" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1259</bibl>; 5, 179; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <cb n="BLAT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris blandis sub armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 137: <cit><quote lang="la">amaracini liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 691</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 258</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">otium consuetudine in dies blandius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiores suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandissima litora, Baiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:96" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: ministerium, Cod. Th. 10, 10, 12, § 1.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et blandae superūm mortalibus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:836" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque admittunt orationes sermonesve... jucunda dictu aut legentibus blanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 12.— </sense><sense id="n5464.9" n="2" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">filiolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 8; cf.: nam et voluptates, blandissimae dominae (<hi rend="ital">the most alluring mistresses</hi>), majores partes animi a virtute detorquent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5464.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Persuading by caressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc experiemur, nostrum uter sit blandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms, <hi rend="ital">soothingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatteringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n5464.11" n="a" level="4"> Anteclass. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 3</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 210, 6</bibl> (also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 256, 15), and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n5464.12" n="b" level="4"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">blandē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compellare hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me adpellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">blande, leniter, dulciter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 71</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and blande ac benedice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepti hospitio ab Tullo blande ac benigne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā lambere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1066</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et satiati agni ludunt blandeque coruscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere fructus,</quote> <trans><tr>to treat carefully</tr>, <tr>gently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1368</bibl></cit> (cf. blandimentum, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">flectere cardinem sonantem,</quote> <trans><tr>softly</tr>, <tr>carefully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:13 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 13 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandius petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 112</bibl></cit>: ad aurem invocabat, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderere fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 13 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandissime appellat hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n5464.13" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">blandum</orth> = blande: <cit><quote lang="la">ridere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 127, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blapsigonia: <entryFree id="n5465" type="greek" key="blapsi^go^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blapsĭgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">blayigoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease which prevents bees from breeding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 20, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blascon: <entryFree id="n5466" type="main" key="Blasco_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blascōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bla/skwn</foreign>, <sense id="n5466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island off the coast of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 600</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blasphemabilis: <entryFree id="n5467" type="main" key="blasphe_ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blasphemo</etym> (eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n5467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censurable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blasphematio: <entryFree id="n5468" type="main" key="blasphe_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n5468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reviling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blasphemia: <entryFree id="n5469" type="greek" key="blasphe_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 715</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">blasfhmi/a</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n5469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reviling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 51, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">towards God,</quote> <trans><tr>blasphemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 62</bibl></cit>, n. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Verb. Dom. Serm. 11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Verb. Dom. Serm. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:15" default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 32, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 26, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blasphemo: <entryFree id="n5470" type="greek" key="blasphe_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n5470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">blasfhme/w</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 20, 7</bibl>; God and divine things, <hi rend="ital">to blaspheme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 24, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 9</bibl>. 3; 26, 65.</sense></entryFree>
blasphemus: <entryFree id="n5471" type="greek" key="blasphe_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blasphēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bla/sfhmos</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n5471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reviling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defaming</hi>: satelles, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 75; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, of God and divine things, <hi rend="ital">blasphemer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 24, 14</bibl> (as transl. of the Heb. <foreign />); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Tim. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blateas: <entryFree id="n5472" type="main" key="blateas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blateas</orth> <itype>bullas luti ex itineribus, aut quod calceamentorum soleis eraditur appellabant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
blateratio: <entryFree id="n5473" type="main" key="bla^te^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blătĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>blatero</etym>, <sense id="n5473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a babbling</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. Idiom. p. 576, 28 Keil.</sense></entryFree>
blateratus: <entryFree id="n5474" type="main" key="bla^te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blătĕrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prating</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canini,</quote> <trans><tr>whining</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 999</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blatero: <entryFree id="n5475" type="main" key="bla^te^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blătĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">bla/c</foreign>, simple, stupid, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll.; cf. blactero</etym>. <sense id="n5475.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To talk idly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to babble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi> (colloq. and mostly ante- and post-class.), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 561, 17</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 78, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud memento, ne quid in primis blateres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 44, 15</bibl>: desine blaterare, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 2</bibl>: cum magno blateras clamore, furisque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his et similibus blateratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 275, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 345, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5475.1" n="II" level="1"> Of the sounds of frogs, Siā <pb n="242" /> <cb n="BOA" /> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; and of camels, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5476" type="gloss" key="bla^te^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blătĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. blatero</etym>, <sense id="n5476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a babbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prater</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
blatio: <entryFree id="n5477" type="main" key="bla^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blătĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindred with blatero</etym>, <sense id="n5477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter foolish things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to babble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prate</hi> (anteclass. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nugas blatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 44, 11 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
blatta: <entryFree id="n5478" type="main" key="blatta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blatta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an insect that shuns the light;</hi> of several kinds, <hi rend="ital">the cockroach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chafer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moth</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:99" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 28, 34, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucifuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 243</bibl></cit> (per noctem vagans, Serv.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:37" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 37</bibl>; cf. Voss, Verg. l. l.—On account of its mean appearance: amore cecidi tamquam blatta in pelvim, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 543, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5479" type="main" key="blatta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blatta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: blatta <foreign lang="greek">qro/mbos ai(/matos</foreign>, <sense id="n5479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clot of blood</hi>, Gloss.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5479.1" n="II" level="1"> (Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">blattea</orth>, Ven. Carm. 2, 3, 19.) <hi rend="ital">Purple</hi> (similar in color to flowing blood; cf. Salmas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 135</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.): purpura, quae blatta, vel oxyblatta, vel hyacinthina dicitur, Cod. Th. 4, 40, 1: serica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:20:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 10, 20, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blattam Tyrus defert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. Ep. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blattarius: <entryFree id="n5480" type="main" key="blatta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blattārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. blatta</etym>, <sense id="n5480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the moth</hi>: balnea, <hi rend="ital">for moths</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dark bathing-rooms</hi> (so called from the dislike of the moth to the light), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5480.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">blattārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">moth-mullein</hi>: Verbascum blattaria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 60, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blattea: <entryFree id="n5481" type="main" key="blattea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blattea</orth>, v. 2. blatta, II.</entryFree>
blatteus: <entryFree id="n5482" type="main" key="blatte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blattĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. blatta, II.</etym>, <sense id="n5482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purple-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blattiarius: <entryFree id="n5483" type="main" key="blatti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blattĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. blatta, II.</etym>, <sense id="n5483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dyer in purple</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2 dub.</sense></entryFree>
blattifer: <entryFree id="n5484" type="hapax" key="blatti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blattĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. blatta, II., -fero</etym>, <sense id="n5484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothed in purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blaudenius: <entryFree id="n5485" type="main" key="Blaude_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blaudēnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n5485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the town</hi> Blaudus (<foreign lang="greek">*blau=dos</foreign>, Strab.), <hi rend="ital">in Phrygia Major</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeuxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blechnon: <entryFree id="n5486" type="greek" key="ble_chnon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blēchnon</orth>, v. blachnon.</entryFree>
blechon: <entryFree id="n5487" type="greek" key="ble_chon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blēchon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">blh/xwn</foreign>, <sense id="n5487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild pennyroyal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 55, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blemmyae: <entryFree id="n5488" type="main" key="Blemmy^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blemmyae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blĕmyae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blemyes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 329</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blemyi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 209</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ble/mues</foreign>, <sense id="n5488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Ethiopian people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:8" default="NO">1, 4, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 33, 4</bibl>; Prob. 17; Claud Nil. 19; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the fable, without head and eyes, and with the mouth in the breast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blendius: <entryFree id="n5489" type="greek" key="blendi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blendĭus</orth> (in MSS. and edd. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">blennĭus</orth>, corresponding more nearly to the Greek), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">blendĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl> Ind. libr. 32, 32), = <foreign lang="greek">ble/nnos</foreign> Oppian., <foreign lang="greek">be/lennos</foreign> Athen., <sense id="n5489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior kind of seafish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 32, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blennus: <entryFree id="n5490" type="greek" key="blennus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blennus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">blenno/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blockhead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simpleton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
blepharon: <entryFree id="n5491" type="main" key="Ble^pha^ro_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blĕphărōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*blefa/rwn</foreign> [eye-lids], <sense id="n5491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comic character in the Amphitruo of Plautus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bliteus: <entryFree id="n5492" type="main" key="bli^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blĭtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blitum</etym>, <sense id="n5492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 1</bibl>: belua, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blitum: <entryFree id="n5493" type="greek" key="bli^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">blĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 17</bibl>: blitus seritur is written prob. from the corrupted or misunderstood blitūseritur, or perh. the obscure blitus eritur of the MSS.), = <foreign lang="greek">bli/ton</foreign>, <sense id="n5493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vegetable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in itself tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but used as a salad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orache</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spinach</hi>: Spinacia oleracea, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 550, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 93, § 252</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blossius: <entryFree id="n5494" type="main" key="Blossi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blossĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>; esp., C. Blossius <hi rend="ital">of Cumœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Stoic and a follower of Ti. Gracchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boa: <entryFree id="n5495" type="main" key="bo^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏva</orth> in the MSS. of Pliny and Festus), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bos; cf. <foreign lang="greek">boubw/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large Italian serpent</hi>: in Italiă appellatae bovae in tantam amplitudinem exeuntes ut divo Claudio principe occisae in Vaticano solidus<cb n="BOEO" />  in alvo spectatus infans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:138" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 47, § 138</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl>; acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl> Müll., <hi rend="ital">a water-serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called because it milked cows</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">because it could swallow an ox</hi>, quas boas vocant, ab eo quod tam grandes sint ut boves gluttire soleant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hil. Erem. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5495.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease producing red pustules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the measles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small-pox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 35, § 53</bibl>: boam id est rubentes papulas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boas fimum bubulum abolet: unde et nomen traxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 75, § 244</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. tama, p. 360 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n5495.2" n="III" level="1"> Crurum quoque tumor viae labore collectus bova appellatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl> Müll. (the same author explains with these words the disease tama).</sense></entryFree>
boadicea: <entryFree id="n5496" type="main" key="Boadice_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boadicēa</orth>, v. Boudicea.</entryFree>
boarius: <entryFree id="n5497" type="main" key="bo^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏārĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvārĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Aem. Scaur. 11, 23</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to neat cattle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIANTES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 913</bibl></cit>: forum, <hi rend="ital">the cattle market at Rome</hi> (in the eighth district of the city, near the Circus Maximus): <cit><quote lang="la">in foro bovario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Aem. Scaur. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 5</bibl> Müll.; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:478" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 478</bibl>, so called from the large brazen statue of an ox placed there; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to fable, because Hercules fed here the herd which he took from Cacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:7" default="NO">2, 4, 7</bibl>: lappa boaria, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 66, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boatus: <entryFree id="n5498" type="main" key="bo^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>boo</etym>, <sense id="n5498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud crying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bellowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boaulia: <entryFree id="n5499" type="main" key="Boaulia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boaulia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Bauli.</entryFree>
bobsequa: <entryFree id="n5500" type="main" key="bobse^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bobsĕqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. bubsequa.</entryFree>
bocas: <entryFree id="n5501" type="gloss" key="bocas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bocas</orth>, v. box.</entryFree>
bocchar: <entryFree id="n5502" type="main" key="Bocchar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bocchar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boc-chor</orth>, ŏris), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Mauritania at the time of the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 30, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 32, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">an African</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boccharum: <entryFree id="n5503" type="main" key="Boccha^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bocchărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the larger of the Balearic islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bocchus: <entryFree id="n5504" type="main" key="Bocchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bocchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Mauritania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father-in-law of Jugurtha</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he gave up bound to Sulla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:80" default="NO" valid="yes">80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:81" default="NO" valid="yes">81</bibl>; 83; 97; 101 sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 5, 5, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5504.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called in honor of him</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*bw/x, bota/nhs ei)=dos</foreign>, Hesych.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 404</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5504.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mauritania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of the former</hi>, Auct. B. Afr 25.</sense></entryFree>
boculus: <entryFree id="n5505" type="main" key="bo_culus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōculus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bōcula</orth>, v. buculus.</entryFree>
bodincus: <entryFree id="n5506" type="main" key="Bodincus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bodincus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Ligurian, = bottomless</etym>, <sense id="n5506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Ligurian name of the river Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bodotria: <entryFree id="n5507" type="main" key="Bo^dotri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏdotrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bode/ria</foreign>, Ptol., <sense id="n5507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bay in Scotland on which the present Edinburgh is situated</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Firth of Forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boduognatus: <entryFree id="n5508" type="main" key="Boduogna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boduognātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of the Nervii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boebe: <entryFree id="n5509" type="main" key="Boebe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boebē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boi/bh</foreign>. <sense id="n5509.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A village in the Thessalian province Pelasgiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the shore of Lake Bœbeïs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 231</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5509.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5509.2" n="1" level="3"> Lacus <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boebēis</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">*boibhi\+s li/mnh</foreign>, Hom. Il. 2, 711), <hi rend="ital">Lake Bœbeïs</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">because in the neighborhood of Ossa: Ossaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 176</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and because Minerva was said to have once bathed her feet in it (cf. Hesiod. Fragm. 50, Göttl. in Strab. 9, p. 640): sanctae Boebeidos undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:449" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 449</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5509.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boebēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bœbeian</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the Thessalian nymphs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:543" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 543</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5509.4" n="II" level="1"> Boebe palus = Boebeïs, <hi rend="ital">Lake Bœbeïs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boeotarches: <entryFree id="n5510" type="main" key="Boeo_tarches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiwta/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n5510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the chief magistrates in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Bœotarch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 43, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
boeotia: <entryFree id="n5511" type="main" key="Boeo_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiwti)a</foreign>. <sense id="n5511.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a district of Greece proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose capital was Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Bacchus and Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; acc. to fable, so called either after Apollo's cow (<foreign lang="greek">*bou=s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 13</bibl>, or from Bœotus, the son of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 186" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 186</bibl>.—Its inhabitants were noted for their stupidity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43</bibl> sqq.; Tert. <cb n="BOLB" /> Anim. c. 20; cf. the Comm. upon Aelian. Var. H. 13, 25; Schol. Apoll. Rhod. Argon. 3, 1241.—</sense><sense id="n5511.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5511.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiw/tios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Bœotian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia = Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:80" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 80</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Bœotians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5511.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiwto/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Bœotian</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus = Boeotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:424" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:493" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 493</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Bœotians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 43, 5</bibl> sq. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Boeotūm = Boeotorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Orb. Terr. 586</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 428</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5511.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiwtiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Bœotian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">napus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 25, § 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5511.5" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boeōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boiwti/s</foreign> = <hi rend="ital">Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5511.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Hyas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5511.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Bœotian woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a lost comedy of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boethius: <entryFree id="n5512" type="main" key="Bo^e_thius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏēthius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: Anicius Manlius Torquatus Severinus, <sense id="n5512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished philosopher and theologian of the post-classic period under Theodoric;</hi> born about A. D. 470; beheaded in prison (A. D. 524), where he composed his most distinguished work, De consolatione philosophiae libri V.</sense></entryFree>
boethus: <entryFree id="n5513" type="greek" key="bo^e_thus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏēthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bohqo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assistant of a scribe</hi> (pure Lat. adjutor), Cod. Valent. 10, 69, 4.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5514" type="main" key="Bo^e_thus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏēthus</orth>, <sense id="n5514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5514.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished sculptor and engraver in silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55</bibl>, §§ 154 and 155.—</sense><sense id="n5514.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bogud: <entryFree id="n5515" type="main" key="Bogud"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bogud</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bogus</orth>; cf. Oud. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 62" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 62</bibl>), <itype>ŭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Bocchus and king of Mauritania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captured and slain bg Agrippa</hi> B.C. 31, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 1</bibl>; Liv. Fragm. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 112</bibl> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 687</bibl> P.; Auct. B. Afr. 23; Suet <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 59" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 59</bibl> and 62.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bogŭdiāna</orth> <itype>Mauretania</itype>, <hi rend="ital">that was ruled by Bogud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bohemi: <entryFree id="n5516" type="main" key="Bohemi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bohemi</orth>, v. Boil.</entryFree>
boia: <entryFree id="n5517" type="main" key="Boia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Boii.</entryFree>
boiae: <entryFree id="n5518" type="main" key="bo^iae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collar for the neck</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kloio/s</foreign> (orig. of leather; hence the name; <cit><quote lang="la">but later of wood or iron),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 27, 12</bibl>: boia <foreign lang="greek">kloio/s</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedicae boiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: attrita boiis colla, Prud. Psych. praef. 34.—For boiam terere, v. Boii <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
boicusager: <entryFree id="n5519" type="main" key="Boicus a^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boicus ăger</orth>, v. Boii.</entryFree>
boiemi: <entryFree id="n5520" type="main" key="Boiemi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boiemi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bohemi</orth>, v. Boii.</entryFree>
boii: <entryFree id="n5521" type="main" key="Bo^ii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boi=oi</foreign> Polyb., <foreign lang="greek">*bo/i+oi</foreign> Strab., <sense id="n5521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, now <hi rend="ital">the Bourbonnais</hi>, Départ. de l'Allier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 2</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">their chief town</hi>, or, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">their country</hi>, was <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl>.—A part of the Boii went to Upper Italy, and occupied the region of the present Parma and Modena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34</bibl> sqq.; 10, 26 sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.—Hence, Boicus ager dicitur, qui fuit Boiorum Gallorum. Is autem est in Galliă citra Alpes, quae togata dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl>.—In Germany also they established themselves, and were called there <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boiemi</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bohemi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boihemi</orth>, <itype>or, by collective term</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boihaemum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (Halm), the present <hi rend="ital">Bohemians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Boia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman of the Boii</hi>, in a pun with boia, the <number>sing.</number> of boiae: <cit><quote lang="la">Boius est, Boiam terit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
boiorix: <entryFree id="n5522" type="main" key="Boio^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boiŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Boii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 46, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5522.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Cimbri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bola: <entryFree id="n5523" type="main" key="Bo_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 6 sq.</bibl> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bōlae</orth>, ārum), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bw=la</foreign>, <sense id="n5523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of the Æqui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Poli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bōlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bola</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 11</bibl></cit>.— And <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bōlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolbitinus: <entryFree id="n5524" type="main" key="Bolbiti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bolbitīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n5524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Bolbitine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rosetta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> <pb n="243" /> <cb n="BOMB" /> <hi rend="ital">Lower Egypt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <trans><tr>the Rosetta mouth of the Nile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl></cit>.—Later collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bolbitĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolbiton: <entryFree id="n5525" type="greek" key="bolbi^to^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bolbĭtŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/lbiton</foreign>, <sense id="n5525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dung of cattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 68, § 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolbulae: <entryFree id="n5526" type="main" key="Bolbu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bolbŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a group of small islands near Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boletaria: <entryFree id="n5527" type="main" key="bo_le_ta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōlētārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (post-class. in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bōlētar</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:2" default="NO">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>; Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>; cf. altaria), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>boletus</etym>, <sense id="n5527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for mushrooms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:101" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 101</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5527.1" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a vessel for cooking and eating in</hi>, Apic. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
boletus: <entryFree id="n5528" type="greek" key="bo_le_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōlētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bwli/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the best kind of mushrooms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:101" default="NO">14, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">much valued by the Romans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:48" default="NO">13, 48</bibl>.—The emperor Claudius is said to have been poisoned by them, Plin. l. l.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolis: <entryFree id="n5529" type="greek" key="bo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boli/s</foreign> (a missile, an arrow), <sense id="n5529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fiery meteor of the form of an arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolites: <entryFree id="n5530" type="greek" key="bo^li_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boli/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the root of the plant</hi> lychnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 98, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boloe: <entryFree id="n5531" type="greek" key="bo_loe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōloe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), = <foreign lang="greek">bw=loi</foreign> (clods of earth), <sense id="n5531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolonae: <entryFree id="n5532" type="greek" key="bo^lo_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏlōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">bo/los</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">w)ne/omai</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n5532.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A draught of fishes set to sale</hi> (post-class.), Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5532.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dealers in fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish-mongers</hi> (postclass.), Gloss. Isid.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bolus: <entryFree id="n5533" type="greek" key="bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/los</foreign>, <sense id="n5533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast</hi> (ante- and post-class.; cf. jactus). </sense><sense id="n5533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5533.2" n="A" level="2"> Of dice in gaming, <hi rend="ital">a throw</hi>: si vis tribus bolis... <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quin tu in malam crucem cum bolis, cum bulbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis lepide jecisti bolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enumerare bolos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5533.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cast of the net</hi> in fishing; and meton., <hi rend="ital">the cast</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the draught</hi> of fishes, <hi rend="ital">the haul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bolum emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5533.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage; a haul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece of fortune</hi>, etc.: primumdum merces annua: is primus bolu'st, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s her first haul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus bolos dat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabit haec tibi grandis bolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 106</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 46, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum bolum deferunt aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:2:16" default="NO">3, 2, 16</bibl>.—Esp.: aliquem tangere bolo, <hi rend="ital">to cozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheedle of gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia amare cernit, tangere hominem volt bolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verum hoc te multabo bolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5533.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A choice bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice morsel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cracior bolum mihi tantum ereptum tam desubito e faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit> Wagn. ad loc.—(In some or all the passages under II. al. refer the word to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h( bw=los</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a clod;</hi> cf.: bolus apud Graecos si per <hi rend="ital">o</hi> scribitur, signficat jactum retis; si per <foreign lang="greek">w</foreign>, glaebam terrae, vel frustum cujusque rei, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; cf.
