Speng. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 10</bibl>.— But bolus is always <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> in Plaut. and Ter., and is scanned bŏlus; v. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 101</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
bombax: <entryFree id="n5534" type="greek" key="bombax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombax</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bomba/c</foreign> (v. Eustath. Od. p. 1718, a), an exclamation of real or affected surprise, <sense id="n5534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indeed! strange! Ca.</hi> Fur. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Babae. <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Fugitive. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Bombax, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 131</bibl> Lambin.</sense></entryFree>
bombinator: <entryFree id="n5535" type="main" key="bombi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the buzzer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hummer</hi>, of the bee, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 999</bibl> Kopp. (al. bombitat ore).</sense></entryFree>
bombio: <entryFree id="n5536" type="gloss" key="bombio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">bombw=</foreign>, <sense id="n5536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buzz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hum</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
bombito: <entryFree id="n5537" type="main" key="bombi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombīto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>bombus; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bombw=</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buzz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hum;</hi> of bees (cf.: bombio, bombitatio, bombus), Auct. Carm. Phil. 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 999</bibl> Eyssenh.</sense></entryFree>
bombizatio: <entryFree id="n5538" type="gloss" key="bombi^za_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombĭzātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the buzzing of bees</hi>: est sonus apium ab ipso sonitu dictus: ut mugitus boum, hinnitus equorum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bombomachides: <entryFree id="n5539" type="main" key="Bombo^ma^chi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bombŏmăchĭdes</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bumb -</orth>, Ritschl), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name formed in ridicule of a boasting soldier</hi>, from bombus = <foreign lang="greek">bo/mbos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ma/xomai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bombos: <entryFree id="n5540" type="main" key="Bombo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bombŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bo/mbos</foreign>, <sense id="n5540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bombus: <entryFree id="n5541" type="greek" key="bombus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/mbos</foreign>, <sense id="n5541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a booming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzzing</hi>: Ennius sonum pedum bombum pedum dixit, Fortun. Dial. (v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 183 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Vahl.); <cb n="BONI" /> of bees; of a horn; <cit><quote lang="la">of the clapping of hands: si (apes) intus faciunt bombum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuba... mugit, Et reboat raucum regio cita barbara bombum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raucisonos efflabant cornua bombos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torva mimalloneis inplerunt cornua bombis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:99" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 99</bibl></cit> Coningt. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, § 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">organorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plausuum genera condiscerent (bombos et imbrices et testas vocabant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit> Casaub.</sense></entryFree>
bombyciae: <entryFree id="n5542" type="greek" key="bomby_ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳcĭae hărundĭnes</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">bombuki/as ka/lamos</foreign> (Theophr. H. P. 4, 12), <sense id="n5542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reeds suitable for flutes</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">bo/mbuc</foreign> (v. Lid. and Scott, s. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bombycinus: <entryFree id="n5543" type="main" key="bomby_ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bombyx</etym>, <sense id="n5543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of silk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silken</hi> (cf. sericus): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 22, 26, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panniculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:260" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23, § 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳcĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">silk garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:50:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 50, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:7" default="NO">8, 68, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 6</bibl>.—And <orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳcĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a silk texture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">web</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bombylis: <entryFree id="n5544" type="greek" key="bomby_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bombuli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the silkworm in its chrysalis state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 22, 26, § 76</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bombȳlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bombu/lios</foreign>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 23, 77.</sense></entryFree>
bombyx: <entryFree id="n5545" type="greek" key="bombyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bombyx</orth>, <itype>ȳcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">bo/mbuc</foreign>. <sense id="n5545.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The silk-worm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 22, 25, § 75</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 27, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5545.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5545.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is made of silk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a silken garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silk</hi>: Arabius, <hi rend="ital">Arabian</hi> (the best), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assyria bombyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5545.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., for <hi rend="ital">any fine fibre</hi>, e. g. <hi rend="ital">cotton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bomilcar: <entryFree id="n5546" type="main" key="Bo^milcar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏmilcar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n5546.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Carthaginian general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Agathocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5546.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Hannibal</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s generals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 36, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5546.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Jugurtha</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards guilty of rebellion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and put to death by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:61" default="NO" valid="yes">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:62" default="NO" valid="yes">62</bibl>; 70 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
bomonicae: <entryFree id="n5547" type="greek" key="Bo_mo^ni_cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bōmŏnīcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bwmonei=kai</foreign>, <sense id="n5547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lacedœmonian youths who allowed themselves to be whipped at the altar of Artemis Orthia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order to gain the honor of firmness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 261" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bona: <entryFree id="n5548" type="main" key="Bo^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏna Dea</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Dīva</orth>), <sense id="n5548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the good goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped by the women of Rome as the goddess of chastity and fertility.</hi> No man was permitted to enter her temple; <cit><quote lang="la">but in later times it became the resort of unchaste women, and the scene of license,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 244</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:637" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:84 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 84 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:314" default="NO">6, 314</bibl>. Clodius invaded this sanctuary, and is hence called by Cicero the priest of the Bona Dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:17:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 17, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bonasus: <entryFree id="n5549" type="greek" key="bo^na_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/nasos</foreign>, <sense id="n5549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of bull in Pœonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the hair of a horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with horns unfit for fighting</hi>, hence saving itself by flight, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl>; cf. Aristot. H. A. 9, 45.</sense></entryFree>
bone: <entryFree id="n5550" type="main" key="bo^ne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = bene, formerly read in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:572" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 572</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:998" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 998</bibl>, by Gifan. after some ancient MSS.; now replaced by bene.</entryFree>
bonifacies: <entryFree id="n5551" type="gloss" key="bo^ni^fa^cies"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnĭfăcies</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)pro/swpos</foreign>, <sense id="n5551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a handsome face</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
bonifatus: <entryFree id="n5552" type="gloss" key="bo^ni^fa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnĭfātus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)/moiros</foreign>, <sense id="n5552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
bonimoris: <entryFree id="n5553" type="gloss" key="bo^ni^mo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnĭmōris</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalo/tropos</foreign>, <sense id="n5553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well-mannered</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
bonitas: <entryFree id="n5554" type="main" key="bo^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bonus</etym>, <sense id="n5554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the good quality of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl> Herz.; class., but mostly in prose). </sense><sense id="n5554.1" n="I" level="1"> Of concrete objects: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri aut oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:86" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 9, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum eādem bonitate solvatur quā datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda bonitas (amomi),</quote> <trans><tr>the second quality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:75:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 75, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5554.2" n="II" level="1"> Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 75</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5554.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq. of character, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">friendly conduct; goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>,<cb n="BONU" />  <hi rend="ital">blamelessness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego nunc de illius bonitate, sed de generi impudentiā disputo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rustici cum fidem alicujus bonitatemque laudant, dignum esse dicunt, quīcum in tenebris mices, id. Off, 3, 19, 77: quae tuae fidei, justitiae bonitatique commendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recte vestram bonitatem atque prudentiam cognovi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec justitiae ullus esset nec bonitati locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam potestatem bonitate retinebat,</quote> <trans><tr>integrity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timol. 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5554.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi>: perpetua naturalis bonitas (<hi rend="ital">kind-heartedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolence</hi>), quae nullis casibus neque agitur, neque minuitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te oro per mei te erga bonitatem patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas et beneficentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 34, 84: homo liberalis et dissolutus et bonitate affluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque incredibile est, et Roscium quicquam per avaritiam appetisse, et Fannium quicquam per bonitatem amisisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas hereditates nullā aliā re quam bonitate consecutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas, humanitas, misericordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5554.5" n="3" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">parental love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam... de bonitate in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facit parentes bonitas, non necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 15, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bonna: <entryFree id="n5555" type="main" key="Bonna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bonna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the Rhine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bonn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70, 77</bibl>; 5, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 26</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bonnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bonna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bononia: <entryFree id="n5556" type="main" key="Bo^no_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏnōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bonwni/a</foreign>. <sense id="n5556.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of</hi> Mutina, <hi rend="ital">a Roman colony founded</hi> A. U. C. 563, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 57, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:599" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 599</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">previously a Tuscan town called</hi> Felsina, now <hi rend="ital">Bologna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; Interpr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 8, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5556.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏnōnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bononia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Rhenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 161</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">C. Rusticellus Bononiensis,</quote> <trans><tr>of Bononia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 169</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5556.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortress in Pannonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Banostor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 11, 6</bibl>; Itin. Anton. —</sense><sense id="n5556.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in</hi> Gallia Belgica, earlier called Gessoriacum, now <hi rend="ital">Boulogne</hi>, Tab. Peuting.</sense></entryFree>
bonum: <entryFree id="n5557" type="main" key="bo^num1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. bonus, I. 5. and II. A. 5.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5559" type="main" key="bo^num2" n="B"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <number>plur.</number> bona; <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭus</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">optĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (v. infra); of things in gen. <sense id="n5559.0" n="1" level="3"> Bonum, or <number>plur.</number> bona, <hi rend="ital">a good</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">goods</hi> in a moral and metaphysical sense, <hi rend="ital">a moral good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blessing</hi>: sunt autem hae de finibus defensae sententiae: nihil bonum nisi honestum, ut Stoici; nihil bonum nisi voluptatem, ut Epicurus; <cit><quote lang="la">nihil bonum nisi vacuitatem doloris, ut Hieronymus... tria genera bonorum, maxima animi, secunda corporis, externa tertia, ut Peripatetici, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:84 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 84 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est igitur bonum? Si quid recte fit et honeste et cum virtute, id bene fieri vere dicitur, et quod rectum et honestum et cum virtute est, id solum opinor bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quis intellegat, quid sit illud simplex et verum bonum quod non possit ab honestate sejungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non-est igitur voluptas bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: finis bonorum et malorum (<foreign lang="greek">te/los a)gaqw=n</foreign>) = summa bona et mala: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt nonnullae disciplinae quae, propositis bonorum et malorum finibus, officium omne pervertant. Nam qui summum bonum sic instituit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 24:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 117, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n5559.1" n="2" level="3"> Bonum, what is <hi rend="ital">valuable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, physically or mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi boni Tantum adfero quantum ipsus a diis optat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa bona vobis volt facere,</quote> <trans><tr>will do you much good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 43:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 43, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demum nostra intellegemus bona quom ea amisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa tibi di dent bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 54</bibl>; 3, 3, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia Bona dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak in the highest terms of one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ne vivus quidem bono caret, si eo non indiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quaecumque bona Peripateticis, eadem Stoicis commoda viderentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 41, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil enim boni nosti,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing that is good for any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala pro bonis legere dementia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl>, ext. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia bonum sit valere,</quote> <trans><tr>a good thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 62</bibl></cit> (cf. III. A. 5. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">melius: quo quidem haud scio an... quidquam melius sit homini a dis immortalibus datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliora... Aristotelem de istis rebus scripsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum: difficillimum est formam exponere optimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 36</bibl></cit>.— Here belongs the phrase boni consulere; <cit><quote lang="la">v. consulo.—So after prepositions: in bonum vertere, v. under verto: in melius ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to change for the better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl></cit>.—In the same sense: in melius aliquid referre, <cb n="BONU" /> or reflectere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 426</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 632</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad melius transcurrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over to something better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.2" n="3" level="3"> Bonum or bona, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter malum qui patitur, idem post patitur bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli est homini perpetuum bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā tecum bona, mala tolerabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in bonis fuerint et nunc quibus in malis sint, ostenditur ( = in secundis, in adversis rebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.3" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Good qualities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gifts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia adsunt bona, quem penes'st virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis illi et divinis bonis hanc licentiam adsequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi qui se suā gravitate et castimoniā... tum etiam naturali quodam bono defenderet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc meā sententiā divinis quibusdam bonis instructum atque ornatum puto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellego quod bonum cuiquam sit apud tales viros profuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaude isto tuo tam excellenti bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si plus adipiscare, re explicatā, boni, quam addubitatā mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe cogitavi bonine an mali plus adtulerit... eloquentiae studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum bonum in celeritate ponebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 4</bibl></cit>; so, bono publico (<case>abl.</case>), <hi rend="ital">for the public good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ita si fit, publico fiat bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.5" n="6" level="3"> With aequum, <hi rend="ital">what is fair and good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fair</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thing</hi>), <hi rend="ital">fairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bonum aequomque oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 149</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu aliquam partem aequi bonique dixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo vivo nec praesens nec absens quidquam aequi bonique impetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 94</bibl></cit>.—Hence, aequo et bono, or ex aequo et bono, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with</hi>) <hi rend="ital">fairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in equity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:137" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 137</bibl>: aequi bonique, as <hi rend="ital">gen. of value</hi>, with facere: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc, Chreme, Aequi bonique facio,</quote> <trans><tr>I place a fair and proper value on it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.6" n="7" level="3"> Bona, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunes</hi>, almost always denoting the whole of one's possessions. </sense><sense id="n5559.7" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">paterna oportet reddi filio bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona sua med habiturum omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; 4, 2, 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona mea diripiebantur atque ad consulem deferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de capite, civis et de bonis proscriptio ferretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona, fortunas, possessiones omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mulctantur bonis exsules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n5559.8" n="b" level="4"> Bonorum possessio, <hi rend="ital">the possession of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property by another.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5559.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Bonorum possessio in consequence of bonorum cessio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an assignment of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property for the benefit of creditors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42</bibl>, tit. 3.—</sense><sense id="n5559.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Bonorum possessio granted by the prætor against a contumacious or insolvent debtor (in bona mittere, in bona ire jubere, bona possidere jubere, etc.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42</bibl>, tit. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">postulat a Burrieno Naevius ut ex edicto bona possidere liceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>, and the whole of c. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">edixit ... neu quis militis... bona possideret aut venderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona proscribere,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer the property thus transferred for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.11" n="(g)" level="5"> Chiefly referring to the property of a defunct person (hereditas), where the prætor, till the heir had proved his right, granted a bonorum possessio secundum tabulas or contra tabulas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37</bibl>, tit. 4; 37, tit. 11.—</sense><sense id="n5559.12" n="c" level="4"> In bonis esse; <cit><quote lang="la">with reference to the older civil law, which distinguished between civil property (habere rem ex jure Quiritium) and natural property (rem in bonis habere, res in bonis est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:40:41" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 40, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:38:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 38, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:2:section=1" default="NO">37, 6, 2, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:3:section=2" default="NO">37, 6, 3, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Fragm. 1:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:1:35" default="NO">1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:1:222" default="NO">1, 222</bibl>; 1, 167; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:10:10" default="NO">27, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque bonorum possessorum, neque... res pleno jure fiunt, sed in bonis efficiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Fragm. 3:80" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence, nullam omnino arbitrabamur de eā hereditate controversiam eum habiturum, et est hodie in bonis, i. e. <pb n="247" /> <cb n="BONU" /> the bonorum possessio has been granted to him, which did not give full ownership, but effected only that the hereditas was in bonis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 30, 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n5559.13" n="III" level="1"> Predicative use. </sense><sense id="n5559.14" n="A" level="2"> With nouns or pronouns as subjects. </sense><sense id="n5559.15" n="1" level="3"> Bonum esse, <hi rend="ital">to be morally good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc mihi bonae necessum est esse ingratiis, Quamquam esse nolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam ego quam beatam me esse nimio dici mavolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque viros fortes magnanimos eosdem, bonos et simplices... esse volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato esse quam videri bonus malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut politiora, non ut meliora fiant ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5559.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be beneficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valuable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, with reference to both persons and things as subjects, and in regard to physical and mental relations: <cit><quote lang="la">jam istuc non bonumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum viridius et melius fiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum ut alvum bonam faciat,</quote> <trans><tr>to correct the bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est homini salute melius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non optuma haec sunt, verum meliora quam deterruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod huc possit quod melius sit accedere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (vestitu), sicut in plerisque rebus, mediocritas optima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliorem tamen militem... in futura proelia id certamen fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvus ut est cygni melior canor, ille gruum quam Clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:191" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si meliora dies, ut vina, poemata reddit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—So in the optative formula: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bonum, faustum, felixque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 15, 1</bibl>; 3, 54; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 34.—Also, quod bonum atque fortunatum mihi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with a noun as subject: ut nobis haec habitatio Bona, fausta, felix, fortunataque evenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus cum probis'st (erus), malus cum malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic si vellet bonus ac benignus Esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5559.18" n="4" level="3"> With reference to the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor ambae (Fortuna et Salus sunt bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladis aut oculos ausa negare bonos (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:24:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 24, 12</bibl></cit> (2, 28, 12).—</sense><sense id="n5559.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5559.20" n="1" level="3"> Bonum est (very rare for the class. bene est; v. bene). </sense><sense id="n5559.21" n="(a)" level="5"> Without a subject: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum sit!</quote> <trans><tr>may it be fortunate</tr>, <tr>favorable!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.22" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et stulte facere, et stulte fabularier in aetate haud bonum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum est pauxillum amare, insane non bonum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3,20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.23" n="2" level="3"> Melius est. </sense><sense id="n5559.24" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius sanam est mentem sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil sentire est melius quam tam prava sentire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 156</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">melius fuit, fuisset, or fuerat,</quote> <trans><tr>it would have been better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde quiesse erit melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 303</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.25" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliu'st te quae sunt mandata tibi praevortier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.26" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid melius quam ut hinc intro abeam et me suspendam clanculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 145</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.27" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subjectclause</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">subjunctive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quid mihi meliu'st quam ilico hic opperiar erum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.28" n="3" level="3"> Optimum est. </sense><sense id="n5559.29" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum visum est, captivos quam primum deportare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis dicit optimum esse navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 8, 4</bibl></cit> (32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>); so, optimum fuit, <hi rend="ital">it would have been better</hi>, and optimum erat, <hi rend="ital">it would be better</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. 3; 11, 2, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.30" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituerunt optimum esse, domum suam quemque reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: optimum visum est, in fluctuantem aciem tradi equos, etc., Liv 6, 24, 10; 22, 27, 6.—</sense><sense id="n5559.31" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vero optimum, ut is qui, etc., id ultimum bonorum, id ipsum quid et quale sit nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.32" n="(d)" level="5"> With quod: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vero optima (sunt) quod cum Haluntium venisset Archagathum vocari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum vero (est) quod dictaturae nomen in perpetuum de re publica sustulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">second sup.</hi>, in <cb n="BORE" /> the phrase optumum factu est (where factu is redundant): <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc mihi optumum factu arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum factu esse duxerant frumento... nostros prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optumum factu credens exercitum augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl></cit> (Kritz, factum); 57, 5 (Kritz, factum).</sense><sense id="n5559.33" n="IV" level="1"> Ellipt. use: di meliora, i. e. dent or velint, i. e. <hi rend="ital">let the gods grant better things than what you say</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">God forbid!</hi> in full: <cit><quote lang="la">di melius duint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora velint!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 37</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora! inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ubi mulier audivit, perturbata, dii meliora inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 513</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly, di melius, i. e. fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.</sense><sense id="n5559.34" n="V" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">object</hi> expressed, </sense><sense id="n5559.35" n="1" level="3"> By <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n5559.36" n="(a)" level="5"> = <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambula, id lieni optumum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia vobis eadem quae mihi bona malaque esse intellexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona bello Cornus, jaculis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.37" n="(b)" level="5"> = benignus or propitius, <hi rend="ital">kind to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinis bonus esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene merenti mala es, male merenti bona es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos o mihi Manes, Este boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 647</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.38" n="(g)" level="5"> = idoneus, <hi rend="ital">fit for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui locus vino optimus dicetur esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum erit ei rei optumum tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra cui putre solum, Optima frumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 286</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.39" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sum</hi> and <case>dat.</case>, in the phrase alicui bono est, <hi rend="ital">it is of service to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profits him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusant in quibus occidi patrem Sex. Roscii bono fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono fuisse Romanis adventum eorum constabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, with <hi rend="ital">rel. dat.</hi>: cui bono (est), <hi rend="ital">for whose advantage it is</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si quis usurpet illud Cassianum cui bono fuerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui bono fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 32</bibl> Ascon. ad loc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt. form cui bono?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1208</bibl></cit> P.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat. gerund</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager oleto conserundo qui in Favonium spectavit, aliis bonus nullus erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mons) quia pecori bonus alendo erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5559.40" n="2" level="3"> By <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refert et ad quam rem bona aut non bona sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio quaeritur idoneane fuerit ad rem adoriendam, an alia melior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non campos modo militi Romano ad proelium bonos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bonus: <entryFree id="n5558" type="main" key="bo^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dŭonus</orth>, Carm. Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 26</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=67" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 67</bibl> Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for duonus, cf. bellum, bis, and cf. root dvi-; hence <foreign lang="greek">dei/dw, de/os</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good; comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">melior</orth>, <itype>us</itype> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/la, ma=llon</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">better; sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">optimus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">optu-mus</orth>, ante-class. and often class.) [root opof ops, opes; cf. copia, apiscor], <hi rend="ital">best.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5558.1" n="I" level="1"> Attributively. </sense><sense id="n5558.2" n="A" level="2"> As adjunct of nouns denoting persons. </sense><sense id="n5558.3" n="1" level="3"> Vir bonus. </sense><sense id="n5558.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A man morally good</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">kalo\s ka)gaqo/s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam boni me viri pauperant, improbi alunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus virtutibus instructos et ornatos tum sapientes, tum viros bonos dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vir bonus qui... intolerabili dolore lacerari potius quam aut officium prodat aut fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive vir bonus est is qui prodest quibus potest, nocet nemini, certe istum virum bonum non facile reperimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ita gerunt ut eorum probitas, fides, integritas, etc. ... hos viros bonos... appellandos putemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellegunt se de callido homine loqui, non de bono viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque est vir optimus, ita difficillime esse alios improbos suspicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim melior vir fuit Africano quisquam, nec clarior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An honest man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia, ex quā viri boni nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 39</bibl>; 2, 12, 42; 2, 20, 71; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 12, 50: cum is sponsionem fecisset ni vir bonus esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam Demosthenes nec vir bonus esset, nec bene meritus de civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A man of good standing in the community</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id viri boni arbitratu deducetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam partem viri bono arbitratu... dari oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="244" /> <cb n="BONU" /> 35; <cit><quote lang="la">37, 6, 2, § 2: quem voles virum bonum nominato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus est... quo res sponsore, et quo causae teste tenentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ironically of wealthy men: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores jus dicunt, aediles ludos parant, viri boni usuras perscribunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Ironically of bad men: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eccum lenonem Lycum, bonum virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expectabam quinam isti viri boni testes hujus manifesto deprehensi veneni dicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam socer ejus, vir multum bonus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so especially in addresses (mostly comic.): age tu, illuc procede, bone vir!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, vir optime? Ecquid habes quod dicas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Sometimes boni viri = boni, in the sense of optimates (v. I. A. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonis viris quid juris reliquit tribunatus C. Gracchi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) As a conventional courtesy: <cit><quote lang="la">homines optimi non intellegunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bone accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic illum amicum vocasti, quomodo omnes candidatos bonos viros dicimus,</quote> <trans><tr>gentlemen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—For bonus vir, <hi rend="ital">a good husband</hi>, v. 3.; and for vir optimus, as a laudatory epithet, v. 5.—</sense><sense id="n5558.8" n="2" level="3"> Boni homines (rare) = boni, <hi rend="ital">better classes of society</hi>, v. II. A. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro infimo boni homines atque dites ambulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5558.9" n="3" level="3"> With nouns denoting persons in regard to their functions, offices, occupations, and qualities, denoting excellence: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 39, 2</bibl> (different: consules duos, bonos quidem, sed dumtaxat bonos, amisimus, <hi rend="ital">consuls of good sentiments</hi>, almost = <hi rend="ital">bad consuls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 3, 4</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">boni tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus senator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senator bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus augur (ironically),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 43</bibl></cit> (cf. trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam, optimam ducem,</quote> <trans><tr>the best guide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">bonus miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 46, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus advocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus defensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus altercator,</quote> <trans><tr>a good debater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus praeceptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:22" default="NO">10, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus gubernator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus opifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutor bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actor optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:57:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 57, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantor optimus est modulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior gladiator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: agricola (colonus, dominus) bonus, Cato, R. R. prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus paterfamilias,</quote> <trans><tr>a thrifty head of the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—Ironically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:178" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 4: bonus (melior, optimus), viz. <hi rend="ital">a good husband</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51 sq.</bibl>;
