<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor, in two senses,</quote> <trans><tr>good authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and = bonus scriptor (post-class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus civis (rarely civis bonus): in re publicā ea velle quae tranquilla et honesta sint: talem enim solemus et sentire bonum civem et dicere, Cic.-Off. 1, 34, 124: eaque est summa ratio et sapientia boni civis, commoda civium non divellere, atque omnes aequitate eādem continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 2:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum esse civem et fidelem et bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 1</bibl>; 6, 6, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 10</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus et fortissimus civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.10" n="4" level="3"> Bonus and optimus as epithets of the gods. </sense><sense id="n5558.11" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed te bonus Mercurius perdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata... bonique divi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divis orte bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O bone deus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: BONORVM DEORVM, Inscr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl>: totidem, pater<cb n="BONU" />  optime, dixi, Tu mihi da cives, referring to Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 627</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.12" n="(b)" level="5"> Optimus Maximus, a standing epithet of Jupiter: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) a majoribus nostris Optimus Maximus (nominatur), et quidem ante optimus, id est beneficentissimus, quam Maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem optimum et maximum ob eas res appellant, non quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 36, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in templo Jovis Optimi Maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 56, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutu Jovis Optimi Maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.13" n="(g)" level="5"> Di boni, O di boni, expressing indignation, sorrow, or surprise: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni, hunc visitavi antidhac!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni, boni quid porto!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni, quid hoc morbi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, O di boni, quam taeter incedebat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:288" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.14" n="(d)" level="5"> Bona Dea, etc., v. 6.—</sense><sense id="n5558.15" n="5" level="3"> Optimus as a laudatory epithet. </sense><sense id="n5558.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Vir optimus: <cit><quote lang="la">per vos nobis, per optimos viros optimis civibus periculum inferre conantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum optimum et constantissimum M. Cispium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem meum, virum optimum, fortissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolabor hos praesentes, viros optimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 19, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.17" n="(b)" level="5"> Femina bona, optima: <cit><quote lang="la">tua conjunx bona femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus sanctissimae feminae atque optimae pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5558.18" n="(g)" level="5"> Senex, pater, frater, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus: parentes ejus, prudentissimi atque optimi senis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuevit pater optimus hoc me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marcelli, fratris optimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6</bibl> (8), 2; 2, 4, 2.—</sense><sense id="n5558.19" n="(d)" level="5"> With proper names (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">optimus Vergilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas optimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime Quinti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Esp. as an epithet of the Roman emperors: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam civile, tam senatorium quam illud, additum a nobis Optimi cognomen?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias, inquit, ago, optime Princeps!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 14</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ex epistulā optimi imperatoris Antonini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:102" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene te patriae pater optime Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime Romulae Custos gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.20" n="6" level="3"> Bonus and Bona, names of deities. </sense><sense id="n5558.21" n="(a)" level="5"> Bona Dea, the goddess of Chastity, whose temple could not be entered by males (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Bonae Deae pulvinaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 39, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:86 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 86 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:314" default="NO">6, 314</bibl> sq.; 6, 335 sq.—</sense><sense id="n5558.22" n="(b)" level="5"> Bonus Eventus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 907</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1780</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n5558.23" n="(g)" level="5"> Bona Fortuna: <cit><quote lang="la">si bona Fortuna veniat, ne intromiseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bonae Fortunae (signum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FORTVNAE BONAE DOMESTICAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1743 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5558.24" n="(d)" level="5"> Bona Spes: <cit><quote lang="la">Spes Bona, obsecro, subventa mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">BONAE SPEI,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Inscr. Grut. 1075:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Inscr. Grut. 1075, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) BONA MENS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1818</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mens Bona, si qua dea es, tua me in sacraria dono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:24:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 24, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n5558.25" n="B" level="2"> With nouns denoting things. </sense><sense id="n5558.26" n="1" level="3"> Things concrete, denoting excellence: <cit><quote lang="la">navis bona dicitur non quae pretiosis coloribus picta est... sed stabilis et firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium bonum dices, non cui auratus est balteus, etc., sed cui et ad secandum subtilis acies est, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 76:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vinum erit lene et bono colore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas... collocare in bono lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: ex quāvis oleā oleum ... bonum fieri potest. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aestatem boves aquam bonam et liquidam bibant semper curato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae aquae, ironically compared to wine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 28: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium bonum caelum habeat,</quote> <trans><tr>good temperature</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā tempestate,</quote> <trans><tr>in good weather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praedium) solo bono valeat,</quote> <trans><tr>by good soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae (aedes) cum curantur male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam bonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scyphi optimi (= optime facti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perbona toreumata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">38: bona domicilia,</quote> <trans><tr>comfortable residences</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Meliorem nemo habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum meliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: fundos optimos et fructuosissimos,<cb n="BONU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni nummi,</quote> <trans><tr>good</tr>, <tr>not counterfeit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super omnia vultus accessere boni,</quote> <trans><tr>good looks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier bonā formā,</quote> <trans><tr>of a fine form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus formae melioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bona cervix, simul ac jussero, demetur,</quote> <trans><tr>fine</tr>, <tr>beautiful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova suci melioris,</quote> <trans><tr>of better flavor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus aequus optimum est aerumnae condimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: bona dextra, <hi rend="ital">a lucky hand</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum omen, 2. e.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio te bonā esse voce, ne clama nimis,</quote> <trans><tr>good</tr>, <tr>sound</tr>, <tr>loud voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bona firmaque vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.27" n="2" level="3"> Things abstract. </sense><sense id="n5558.28" n="a" level="4"> Of physical well-being: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qui neget sine bonā valetudine posse bene vivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 51, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 22:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:35" default="NO">11, 2, 35</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non bonus somnus de prandio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>prime of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimā aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā, inquis, aetate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.29" n="b" level="4"> Of the mind and soul: <cit><quote lang="la">meliore esse sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona conscientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:93" default="NO">9, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono ingenio me esse ornatam quam auro multo mavolo,</quote> <trans><tr>with a good heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 21, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61</bibl>.—Personified, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 24, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos optimae indolis filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona voluntas,</quote> <trans><tr>a good purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona ratio cum perditā... confligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.30" n="c" level="4"> Of moral relations: <cit><quote lang="la">ego si bonam famam mihi servasso, sat ero dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 61</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. e. infra): si ego in causā tam bonā cessi tribuni plebis furori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, sis, bonae frugi sies,</quote> <trans><tr>of good</tr>, <tr>regular habits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 3 sq.</bibl> (v. frux, II. B. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.): vilicus disciplinā bonā utatur. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona studia,</quote> <trans><tr>moral pursuits</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid vitā meliore parasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: ad spem mortis melioris, <hi rend="ital">an honorable death;</hi> so as an epithet of religious exercises: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, te bonas preces precor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.31" n="d" level="4"> Of external, artistic, and literary value and usefulness: <cit><quote lang="la">bono usui estis nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Optumo optume optumam operam das,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam dedistis mihi operam,</quote> <trans><tr>a valuable service to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 11</bibl> (in a different sense: me bonā operā aut malā Tibi inventurum esse auxilium argentarium, <hi rend="ital">by fair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unfair means</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 102</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. e. infra): optima hereditas a patribus traditur liberis... gloria virtutis rerumque gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum otium,</quote> <trans><tr>valuable leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis versibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus meliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meliora poemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illā pro Ctesiphonte oratione longe optimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimas fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius munus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.32" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Procilio rumores non boni,</quote> <trans><tr>unfavorable rumors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona de Domitio, praeclara de Afranio fama est,</quote> <trans><tr>about their success in the war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fuisset in discipulo comparando meliore fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fortunā optimā esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in the best pecuniary circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio tam bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex est eo meliore condicione quam adulesoens cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in phrase bona spes.—Object.: ergo in iis adulescentibus bonam spem esse dicemus et magnam indolem quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>.—Subject.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum spe bonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl>; <pb n="245" /> <cb n="BONU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl> a, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimā spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—Pregn., = spes bonarum rerum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. C. 1. c. infra: meliora responsa,</quote> <trans><tr>more favorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior interpretatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum laude et bonis recordationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis Doctus iter melius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>less injurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen bonum,</quote> <trans><tr>a good</tr>, <tr>lucky omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Liv. praef. § 13: melius omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:221" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 221</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">optimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona scaeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicio optumo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">memini bene, sed meliore Tempore dicam = opportuniore tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.33" n="f" level="4"> Of public affairs, si mihi bonā re publicā frui non licuerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus bonis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">optimis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae res meliore loco videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 137</bibl>; id. Phil, 1, 8, 19.—</sense><sense id="n5558.34" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Good</hi> = <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono atque amplo lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona librorum copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona copia cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 88</bibl></cit>; v. bona pars, C. 8. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.35" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Noble;</hi> with genus, <hi rend="ital">good family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble extraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable birth</hi>: quali me arbitraris genere prognatum? <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Bono, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 35</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bono genere natus sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5558.36" n="k" level="4"> Referring to good-will, kindness, faithfulness, in certain phrases. </sense><sense id="n5558.37" n="(a)" level="5"> Bonā veniā or cum bonā veniā, <hi rend="ital">with the kind permission</hi> of a person addressed, especially bonā veniā orare, expetere, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum abs te hoc bonā veniā expeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā tuā veniā dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orāvit bonā veniā Quirites, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro vos.. bonā veniā vestrā liceat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā quaeso audiatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; Arn. c. Gent. 1, p. 5; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">. sed des veniam bonus oro = veniā bonā oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.38" n="(b)" level="5"> Bona pax, <hi rend="ital">without quarrelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona pax sit potius,</quote> <trans><tr>let us have no quarrel about that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so especially cum bonā pace, or bonā pace: Hannibal ad Alpis cum bonā pace incolentium... pervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>without a difficulty with the inhabitants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 24, 3</bibl>; 28, 37, 4; 8, 15, 1; cf.: si bonam (pacem) dederitis, = <hi rend="ital">a fair peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under acceptable conditions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 21, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.39" n="(g)" level="5"> Amicitia bona = bonā fide servata, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed friendship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur amicitia Masinissae bona atque honesta nobis permansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.40" n="(d)" level="5"> Bona societas, <hi rend="ital">alliance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Segestes, memoriā bonae societatis, impavidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n5558.41" n="C" level="2"> In particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n5558.42" n="1" level="3"> Bonae res. </sense><sense id="n5558.43" n="a" level="4"> = Vitae commoda, <hi rend="ital">comforts of life</hi>, abstract or concrete: <cit><quote lang="la">concedatur bonis rebus homines morte privari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimis rebus usus est,</quote> <trans><tr>he had every most desirable thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.44" n="b" level="4"> = Res secundae, opp. res adversae, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis rebus tuis, meas irrides malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bonis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5558.45" n="c" level="4"> Res bona = res familiaris bona, <hi rend="ital">wealth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): in re bonā esse, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 4</bibl>.—Also an object of value: <cit><quote lang="la">homines quibus mala abunde omnia erant, sed neque res neque spes bona ulla,</quote> <trans><tr>who had no property</tr>, <tr>nor the hope of any</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5558.46" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Costly things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">articles of luxury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere urbem in Arabiā plenam bonarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium rei bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantia bonarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 5</bibl></cit>' bonis rebus gaudere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">re bonā copiosum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.47" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Moral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morally good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi cum res non bonas tractent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de virtutibus et vitiis, omninoque de bonis rebus et malis quaererent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habemus in rebus bonis et malis explorati?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 129</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tamen omnia dulciora fuint et moribus bonis et artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.48" n="f" level="4"> In literary composition, <hi rend="ital">important</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interesting matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjects</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">questions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res bonas verbis electis dictas quis non legat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis generorum, praesertim in re bonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 8, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.49" n="2" level="3"> Bonae artes. </sense><sense id="n5558.50" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudable way of dealing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praeclari facinoris aut artis bonae famam quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic bonae artes desunt, dolis atque fallaciis contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod is bonarum artium cupiens erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6</bibl></cit>, <cb n="BONU" /> 46.—</sense><sense id="n5558.51" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Liberal arts and sciences</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris aut ulli bonae arti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conservate civem bonarum artium, bonarum partium, bonorum virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 32, 77</bibl></cit>. —Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">optimae artes: optimarum artium scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.52" n="3" level="3"> Bona fides, or fides bona. </sense><sense id="n5558.53" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Good faith</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">conscious honesty in acts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">words</hi>: qui nummos fide bonā solvit, <hi rend="ital">who pays</hi> (the price of labor) <hi rend="ital">in good faith</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">as it is honestly earned</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic, bonā fide, tu id aurum non subripuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi optimā fide omnia concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 23</bibl>.—Hence, bonae fidei vir, <hi rend="ital">a conscientious man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.54" n="b" level="4"> Jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n5558.55" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Good faith in contracts and legal acts</hi> in general, opposed to dolus malus, <hi rend="ital">honesty and fairness in dealing with another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fidem bonam statuit pertinere, notum esse emptori vitium quod nosset venditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>.—Hence, alienam rem bonā fide emere, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believing the seller to be the rightful owner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:13:section=1" default="NO">41, 3, 13, § 1</bibl>. bonae fidei possessor (also possessio), <hi rend="ital">believing that he is the rightful owner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25:section=11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 3, 25, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:22" default="NO">5, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:15:section=2" default="NO">41, 3, 15, § 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">41, 3, 24: conventio contra bonam fidem et mores bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:31:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 31, § 7</bibl></cit>: bonam fidem praestare, <hi rend="ital">to be responsible for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s good faith</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 1, 10</bibl> prooem.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5558.56" n="(b)" level="5"> Bonae fidei actiones or judicia, <hi rend="ital">actions in equity</hi>, i. e. certain classes of actions in which the strict civil law was set aside by the prætorian edict in favor of equity: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones quaedam bonae fidei sunt, quaedam stricti juris. Bonae fidei sunt haec: exempto vendito, locato conducto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:6:28:section=19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 6, 28, § 19</bibl></cit>.—In the republican time the prætor added in such actions to his formula for the judex the words ex fide bonā, or, in full: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid dare facere oportet ex fide bonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste dolus malus et legibus erat vindicatus, et sine lege, judiciis in quibus additur ex fide bonā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.57" n="4" level="3"> Bona verba. </sense><sense id="n5558.58" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Kind words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bona verba quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.59" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Words of good omen</hi> (v. omen): <cit><quote lang="la">dicamus bona verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite suffuso ter bona verba mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:638" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 638</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.60" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Elegant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">well-chosen expressions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tam furiosum quam verborum vel optimorum atque ornatissimorum sonitus inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum bonorum cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:233" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 66, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia verba sunt alicubi optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.61" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Moral sayings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est quod contemnas bona verba et bonis cogitationibus plena praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5558.62" n="5" level="3"> Bona dicta. </sense><sense id="n5558.63" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc petere me precario a vobis jussit leniter dictis bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.64" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Witticisms</hi> (<hi rend="ital">bon-mots</hi>): flammam a sapiente facilius ore in ardente opprimi, quam bona dicta teneat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:54:222" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 54, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico unum ridiculum dictum de dictis melioribus quibus solebam menstruales epulas ante adipiscier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo intro ad libros ut discam de dictis melioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.65" n="6" level="3"> Bona facta. </sense><sense id="n5558.66" n="(a)" level="5"> = bene facta (v. bene, I. B. 2. b.), <hi rend="ital">laudable deeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas ambobus et majorum bona facta (sc. erant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.67" n="(b)" level="5"> Bonum factum est, colloq., = bene est, bene factum est (v. bene, I. B. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonum factum est, ut edicta servetis mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec imperata quae sunt pro imperio histrico, bonum hercle factum (est) pro se quisque ut meminerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n5558.68" n="(g)" level="5"> Elliptically, introducing commands which cannot be enforced, = <hi rend="ital">if you will do so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it will be well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinis in senatum allectis, libellus propositus est: bonum factum, ne quis senatori novo curiam monstrare velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Chaldaeos edicere: bonum factum, ne Vitellius ... usquam esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac die Carthaginem vici: bonum factum, in Capitolium eamus, et deos supplicemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:49" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o edictum, cui adscribi non poterit bonum factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.69" n="7" level="3"> Bona gratia. </sense><sense id="n5558.70" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A friendly understanding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non videmus inter nos haec potius cum bonā Ut componantur gratiā quam cum malā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per gratiam bonam abire,</quote> <trans><tr>to part with good feelings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—In jest: sine bonā <cb n="BONU" /> gratiā abire, <hi rend="ital">of things cast away</hi>, Plaut Truc. 2, 7, 15.—</sense><sense id="n5558.71" n="(b)" level="5"> Pleon., in the phrase bonam gratiam habere, = gratiam habere, <hi rend="ital">to thank</hi> (v. B. 2. k.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.72" n="8" level="3"> Bona pars. </sense><sense id="n5558.73" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The well-disposed part</hi> of a body of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plerumque fit, major pars (i. e. of the senate) meliorem vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars melior senatūs ad meliora responsa trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.74" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The good party</hi>, i. e. the optimates (gen. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">civem bonarum partium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 32, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fuit) meliorum partium aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi gratiam melioris partis velit quaesitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 3</bibl></cit>.—Paronom.: (Roscius) semper partium in re publicā tam quam in scaenā optimarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">party</hi> and <hi rend="ital">part in a drama</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.75" n="(g)" level="5"> Of things or persons, <hi rend="ital">a considerable part</hi> (cf. <hi rend="ital">a good deal</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">bonam partem ad te adtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam partem sermonis in hunc diem esse dilatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam magnamque partem exercitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">bona pars noctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona pars hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae vocis... bona pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior pars diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 156</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.76" n="(d)" level="5"> Rarely, and mostly eccl. Lat.: optima pars, <hi rend="ital">the best part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri melior pars animus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 14; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pars optima est in homine,</quote> <trans><tr>best</tr>, <tr>most valuable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major pars aetatis, certe melior reipublicae data sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maria optimam partem elegit, quae non auferetur ab eā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 42</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam partem = ex magnā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1249</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Aliquem in optimam partem cognoscere, <hi rend="ital">to know somebody from his most favorable side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl>: aliquid in optimam partem accipere, <hi rend="ital">to take something in good part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpret it most favorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar mihi ignoscit quod non venerim, seseque in optimam partem id accipere dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit> a, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso ut hoc in bonam partem accipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.77" n="9" level="3"> Dies bonus or bona. </sense><sense id="n5558.78" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A day of good omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fortunate day</hi> (= dies laetus, faustus): <cit><quote lang="la">tum tu igitur die bono, Aphrodisiis, addice, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc dicenda bonā sunt bona verba die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.79" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 22:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 22, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.80" n="10" level="3"> Bonus mos. </sense><sense id="n5558.81" n="(a)" level="5"> Boni mores, referring to individuals, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moral habits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est amabilius quam morum similitudo bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hic nimium morbus mores invasit bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi militiaeque boni mores colebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter ejus suavissimos et optimos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per tot annos matronae optimis moribus vixerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores meliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.82" n="(b)" level="5"> Bonus mos or boni mores, in the abstract, <hi rend="ital">morality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the laws</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rules of morality</hi>: ei vos morigerari mos bonu'st, <hi rend="ital">it is a rule of morality that you should</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex optimo more et sanctissimā disciplinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegentia boni moris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 1</bibl></cit>.—Jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">conventio, mandatum contra bonos mores,</quote> <trans><tr>in conflict with morality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:157" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 157</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n5558.83" n="11" level="3"> Adverbial phrases. </sense><sense id="n5558.84" n="a" level="4"> Bono animo esse, or bonum animum habere. </sense><sense id="n5558.85" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be of good cheer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo es! Liberabit ille te homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 4</bibl>; 4, 5, 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo bono es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo es, inquit Scrofa, et fiscinam expedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo sint et tui et mei familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo esse jubere eam consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habe modo bonum animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habe animum bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum animum habe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor ortus ut bonum animum haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.86" n="(b)" level="5"> Bono animo esse, or facere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to be of a good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friendly disposition</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to do with good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honest intentions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire jubet vos imperator histricus, bonoque ut animo sedeant in subselliis qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: sunt enim (consules) <pb n="246" /> <cb n="BONU" /> optimo animo, summo consilio, <hi rend="ital">of the best disposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono te animo tum populus Romanus... dicere existimavit ea quae sentiebatis, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nondum bono animo in populum Romanum viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.87" n="(g)" level="5"> Bonus animus, <hi rend="ital">good temper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus animus in malā re dimidium mali est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos etiam hoc animo meliore feratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 433</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.88" n="b" level="4"> Bono modo. </sense><sense id="n5558.89" n="(a)" level="5"> = placide, <hi rend="ital">with composure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis quid deliquerit, pro noxā bono modo vindicet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi tam sunt defendenda quam moenia, mihi autem bono modo, tantum quantum videbitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.90" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In a decent manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quisquam prohibeto filium quin amet... quod bono fiat modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5558.91" n="c" level="4"> Jure optimo or optimo jure, <hi rend="ital">with good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfect right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipse jure optumo incuses licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jure optimo me deserere posses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 2</bibl> (29), 2.—With <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intr. verb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deservedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne jure optimo irrideamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 1, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly, optimo judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n5558.92" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5558.93" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnus</orth>, <itype>boni</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; of persons. </sense><sense id="n5558.94" n="1" level="3"> In <number>sing.</number> or <number>plur.</number> orig. = bonus vir, boni viri; v. I. A. 1. a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra, <hi rend="ital">a morally good man.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5558.95" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis quod bene fit haud perit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius apud bonos quam apud fortunatos beneficium collocari puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum esse ut bonos boni diligant, quamobrem... bonis inter bonos quasi necessariam (esse) benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diverso itinere malos a bonis loca tætra... habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:22" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt peccare boni virtutis amore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bonis quam malis conduntur urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:28:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl>.—Rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">good women</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia omnes bonos bonasque adcurare addecet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.96" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus bonum malum esse volt ut sit sui similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim cuique bono mali quidquam evenire potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui meliorem audax vocet in jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.97" n="2" level="3"> Bonus, <hi rend="ital">a man of honor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5558.98" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A brave man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quā (patriā) quis bonus dubitet mortem oppetere si ei sit profuturus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem quam nemo bonus nisi cum animā simul amittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes creantur fortibus et bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit> (opp. ignavi): <cit><quote lang="la">famā impari boni atque ignavi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 11, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5558.99" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A gentleman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim umquam, qui paululum modo bonorum consuetudinem nosset, litteras ad se ab amico missas ... in medium protulit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5558.100" n="3" level="3"> Boni, <hi rend="ital">the better</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">higher</hi>) <hi rend="ital">classes of society.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5558.101" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen. (of political sentiments, = optimates, opp. populares, seditiosi, perditi cives, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">so usu. in Cic.): meam causam omnes boni proprie enixeque susceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaces homines et perditi nutu impelluntur... boni, nescio quomodo, tardiores sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Kal. Jan. senatum et bonos omnes legis agrariae... metu liberavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim omnes boni, quantum in ipsis fuit, Caesarem occiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2</bibl>. 12, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis increpat omnes bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:22" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 22</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">optimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 37</bibl></cit>; and, ironically, boni identified with <hi rend="ital">the rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum, id est lautorum et locupletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.102" n="(b)" level="5"> Without reference to political views;
