<cit><quote lang="la">opp. vulgus (rare): nihil ego istos moror fatuos mores quibus boni dedecorant se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper in civitate quibus opes nullae sunt bonis invident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus est sine ullā pompā funeris, comitantibus omnibus bonis, maximā vulgi frequentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—So, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĕlĭōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s betters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaestui habeant male loqui melioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da locum melioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5558.103" n="4" level="3"> Boni, bone, in addresses, as an expression of courtesy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">ironice</hi>, id. S. <cb n="BONU" /> 2, 3, 31.—</sense><sense id="n5558.104" n="5" level="3"> Optimus quisque = quivis bonus, omnes boni. </sense><sense id="n5558.105" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to morality: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquid naturā pulcrum quod optimus quisque sequeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>every good man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita se gerebant ut sua consilia optimo cuique probarent, optimates habebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl>; and = <hi rend="ital">even the best</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare deus optimum quemque malā valetudine adficit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.106" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the educated classes: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibenda est quaedam reverentia adversus homines, et optimi cujusque et reliquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina plerisque consularibus, praeterea optumo cuique, litteras mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimo cuique infesta libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 8, 2</bibl></cit> (32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n5558.107" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optumus quisque cadere et sauciari, ceteris metus augeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5558.108" n="(d)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus quisque facere quam dicere... malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">ita imperium semper ad optumum quemque a minus bono transfertur,</quote> <trans><tr>to the best man in each instance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Referring to another superlative ( = quo quisque melior eo magis, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic aditus laudis qui semper optimo cuique maxime patuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 18, 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Attributively, with a noun: <cit><quote lang="la">optimam quamque causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima quaeque dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bonuscula: <entryFree id="n5560" type="main" key="bo^nuscu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏnuscŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bonus</etym>, <sense id="n5560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small possessions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little estate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de bonusculis avitis et paternis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 10, 10, 29, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
boo: <entryFree id="n5561" type="main" key="bo^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏo</orth> (with the digamma <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvo</orth>, Enn.; <sense id="n5561.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), āre or <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>from the root bo, kindr. with Sanscr. gu and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">boa/w</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 4</bibl>; acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl> Müll. directly from the Gr.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roar</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class., and in the poets). </sense><sense id="n5561.1" n="a" level="4"> Bŏvo, āre: clamore bovantes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (Ann. v. 571 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n5561.2" n="b" level="4"> Bŏo, ĕre: clamore et sonitu colles resonantes bount, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (Trag. Rel. v. 223 Rib.; Varr. ib.; perh. in both pass. we should read boant; cf. Ussing ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 77</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n5561.3" n="c" level="4"> Bŏo, āre (the usual form): <cit><quote lang="la">boat Caelum fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 450</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boopes: <entryFree id="n5562" type="greek" key="bo^o_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏōpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bow=pes</foreign>, <sense id="n5562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, pure Lat. caerefolium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bootes: <entryFree id="n5563" type="main" key="Bo^o_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n5563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Bootae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 722</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Rudd. I. p. 76, n. 48: Bootis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:24" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 364</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">856</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 70, 9</bibl>: Booti, Cic. Arat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 706</bibl>; v. 100 B. and K., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 110</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Booten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:733" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 733</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Boote, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 176</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bow/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the nearly stationary constellation Bootes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Bear-keeper</hi>, = Arctophylax (q. v.; cf. also arcturus), Cic. Arat. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:447 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 447 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:405" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 405</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Germ. Arat. 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bora: <entryFree id="n5564" type="main" key="Bora"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bora</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nitje</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 8 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
borcani: <entryFree id="n5565" type="main" key="Borca_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Borcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
borealis: <entryFree id="n5566" type="main" key="bo^re^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. boreas, II. B.</entryFree>
boreas: <entryFree id="n5567" type="main" key="bo^re^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrĕas</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">borras</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 847</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 245</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bore/as</foreign> <cb n="BOS" /> or <foreign lang="greek">*borra=s</foreign>. <sense id="n5567.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The north wind;</hi> pure Lat aquilo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus boreā rigida spirante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 316</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 687</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 185</bibl></cit>; 13, 418; 15, 471; Col. poët. 10, 288; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:82" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 82</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Borean, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:543" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:705" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 705</bibl>; 8, 183; 10, 289; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 644</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 26, 51; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5567.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5567.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The north</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae finitimum latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5567.3" n="2" level="3"> Personified, <hi rend="ital">the son of the river-god Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Calais and Zetes by Orithyia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Erectheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 711</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 51</bibl> (3, 22, 31).—</sense><sense id="n5567.4" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5567.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrī^us</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrē^us</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">bo/reios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the north wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub axe boreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 32, 1</bibl> Lind. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 3, 36; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 5, 5: frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">789</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bo/reiov</foreign>: promonturium, <foreign lang="greek">*bo/reion a)/kpon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">in Cyrenaica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5567.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">northern</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Avienus): flamina,</quote> <trans><tr>the north winds</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. Arat. 951</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Perieg. 84</bibl> and 292.</sense></entryFree>
boreotis: <entryFree id="n5568" type="main" key="bo^re^o_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrĕōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n5568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">borew=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">northern; acc. plur.</hi> boreotidas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 577</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boria: <entryFree id="n5569" type="main" key="bo^ri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/reia</foreign> (northern), a <sense id="n5569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kind of jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
borion: <entryFree id="n5570" type="main" key="Bo^ri_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrīon</orth>, v. boreas, II. A.</entryFree>
borith: <entryFree id="n5571" type="foreign" key="bo_rith"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōrith</orth> = <foreign />, <sense id="n5571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant purifying like soap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soapwort</hi> (herbe savonnieère, Jarchi Malach. 3, 2; cf. Ges. and Robinson's Heb. Lex. under <foreign />), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 2, 22</bibl>, and Mal. 3, 2.</sense></entryFree>
borras: <entryFree id="n5572" type="main" key="borras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">borras</orth>, v boreas <sense id="n5572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
borrio: <entryFree id="n5573" type="main" key="borrio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">borrio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bur-</orth>), <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n5573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stipite formicarum nidificia borriebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
borysthenes: <entryFree id="n5574" type="main" key="Bo^rysthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrysthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*borusqe/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n5574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large but gently-flowing river in Sarmatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which empties into the Black Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Dnieper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO">2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5574.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5574.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrysthĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Borysthenes</hi>: amnis, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> circumlocution for <hi rend="ital">Borysthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5574.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrysthĕnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*borusqeni/s</foreign>, the same: ora, Calvus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:page=1395" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> p. 1395</bibl> P.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏry-sthĕnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a town on the Borysthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously called Olbia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony from Miletus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kudak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the region of the present Oczakow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of Nikolajew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl> (here erroneously distinguished from Olbia).—</sense><sense id="n5574.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrysthĕnĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near the Borysthenes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5574.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏrysthĕ-nītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*borusqeni=tai</foreign>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bos: <entryFree id="n5575" type="main" key="bo_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōs</orth>, <itype>bŏvis</itype> (prob. orig. form of <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏ-vis</orth>, <itype>like bovare for boare</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62, 13</bibl>; cf. Varr L. L. 8, § 74 Müll., where, acc. to Cod. B., the read. should be: nunc in consuetudine aliter dicere pro Jovis Juppiter, pro Bovis Bos, pro Strus Strues.—Hence, <sense id="n5575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> bŏvĕrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 62</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. Varr. L. L. l. l.: alios dicere Boum greges, alios Boverum; v. Juppiter, nux, rex, sus, and Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. 2, p. 171</bibl>.— Regular <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> boum very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">uncontracted form bovum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit> Halm; Cod. Sang. Colum. 6, 17, 6; 6, 37, 11, and Cod. Reg. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 38, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 773</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Dat. plur.</hi> contr. bōbus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl>, twice; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 773 sq.</bibl> P.; but more freq. and class. būbus, even <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54, 60</bibl>; 54, 70; 54, 73; <cit><quote lang="la">once bŭbŭs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 62, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">on the other hand,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 8, 86</bibl></cit>.—Exs. of the uncontracted form bovibus are entirely. wanting; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 280 sqq.; 1, 289), <gen>comm.</gen>; generally <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> in prose (hence, femina bos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>) [from the root bo-, prop. the roaring, kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bou=s, bw=s</foreign>; Sanscr. gō, gu]. </sense><sense id="n5575.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cow;</hi> described by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:12" default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl> sq.; 2, 5, 7.—In gen.: quia boves bini hic sunt in crumenā, <pb n="248" /> <cb n="BOTH" /> <hi rend="ital">i.</hi> e. <hi rend="ital">the price of them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiae per stadium ingressus esse Milo dicitur, cum umeris sustineret bovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consimili ratione venit bubus quoque saepe Pestilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cura boum, qui cultus habendo Sit pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos est enectus arando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:50 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 50 sq.</bibl>; Col. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 11, 1 sq.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actae boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bove eximiā captā de grege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 873</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">torva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incustoditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:684" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidisti si quas Boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:700" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forda, fecunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:630" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 630</bibl></cit> and 631 al. —Prov.: bovi clitellas imponere, <hi rend="ital">to put a pack - saddle upon an ox</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to assign one a duty for which he is not qualified</hi>, old Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 3</bibl> (in the form non nostrum onus: <cit><quote lang="la">bos clitellas (sc. portabat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 21</bibl></cit> Spald.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">optat ephippia bos, piger optat arare caballus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl>.—Humorously, for <hi rend="ital">a whip cut from neat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s leather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a raw hide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vivos homines mortui incursant boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: bos Lucas, <hi rend="ital">the elephant;</hi> v. Lucani, D.—</sense><sense id="n5575.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-fish of the genus of the turbot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 94</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boscis: <entryFree id="n5576" type="greek" key="boscis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">boscis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">boska/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of duck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl> (perh., acc. to the Greek, more correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">boscăs</orth>, ădis; v. Schneid. Comment. in h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
bosporus: <entryFree id="n5577" type="main" key="Bospo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bospŏrus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bosphŏrus</orth> (in MSS. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bosfŏrus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n5577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:68" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 68</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">*bo/sporos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*bo/sforos</foreign> (i. e. the heifer's ford, on account of Io's passage here as a heifer), <hi rend="ital">the name of several straits</hi>, and particularly, </sense><sense id="n5577.1" n="A" level="2"> Thracius, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*bo/sporos *qra/(kios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">between Thrace and Asia Minor</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Strait</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Channel of Constantinople</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:2" default="NO">1, 2, 2</bibl> and 6; 1, 19, 5 and 12; 2, 2, 6; 2, 7, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 43, § 149</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:345" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 345</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5577.2" n="B" level="2"> Cimmerius, <hi rend="ital">the Cimmerian Bosporus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leading from the Black Sea to the Azof</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Strait of Kertsch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Jenikaleh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:15" default="NO">1, 19, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:17" default="NO">1, 19, 17</bibl>; 1, 19, 18; 2, 1, 2 and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> Bospore, <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, of the land adjoining the Bosporus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 10), 68.—</sense><sense id="n5577.3" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5577.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bospŏrĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bospŏrĕus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 55</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bospo/rios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bosporus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:298" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 298</bibl></cit> Jahn. —</sense><sense id="n5577.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bospŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5577.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bospŏrānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bosph-, Bosf-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bosporano/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a dweller on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near the</hi> Bosporus Cimmerius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15, 16</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 15, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bostar: <entryFree id="n5578" type="main" key="Bostar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bostar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Aem. Scaur. 2, 1</bibl> sqq.; 4, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 9</bibl> sqq.; 23, 34, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:647" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 647</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bostra: <entryFree id="n5579" type="main" key="Bostra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bostra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bo/stra</foreign>, <sense id="n5579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the Roman province of Arabia from the time of Trajan</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bozra</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 13</bibl>. —Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bosra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 34, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:48:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 48, 24 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bostrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bozra.</hi>—Only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bostrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Bozra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3440</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bostrychites: <entryFree id="n5580" type="greek" key="bostry^chi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bostrychītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bostruxi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bostrychus:
<entryFree id="n5581" type="greek" key="bostry^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bostrychus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/struxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in ringlets</hi>: crines, Firm. Math. 4, 12.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtănĭcum</orth> <itype>herbarium dicitur, quod ibi herbae notentur</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botanismus: <entryFree id="n5582" type="greek" key="bo^ta^nismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtănismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">botanismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pulling up of weeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botellus: <entryFree id="n5583" type="main" key="bo^tellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>botulus</etym>, <sense id="n5583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sausage</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:13" default="NO">11, 31, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
boterdum: <entryFree id="n5584" type="main" key="Boterdum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boterdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:49:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 49, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:11" default="NO">12, 18, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bothynus: <entryFree id="n5585" type="greek" key="bo^thy_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏthȳnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/qunos</foreign>, <sense id="n5585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fiery meteor in the form of a pit</hi>: sunt bothynoe (acc. to the Gr. form = bothyni, like adelphoe, arctoe, etc.) cum velut coronā cingente introrsus ingens caeli recessus est similis effossae in orbem speluncae. Sen. Q. <cb n="BOVI" /> N. 1, 14, 1 (Haas. as Greek); App. de Mundo, pp. 58 and 64.</sense></entryFree>
botrax: <entryFree id="n5586" type="gloss" key="bo^trax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtrax</orth> dicta quod ranae habeat faciem. Nam Graeci ranam <foreign lang="greek">bo/traka (ba/traxon</foreign>?) vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 4, 35</bibl>.</entryFree>
botronatus: <entryFree id="n5587" type="greek" key="bo_^tro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^trōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bo/trus</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament for the hair of a female</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of a cluster of grapes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Hab. Virg. p. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botruosus: <entryFree id="n5588" type="main" key="bo_^tru^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^trŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>botrus</etym>, <sense id="n5588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clusters</hi> (pure Lat. racemosus), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botrus: <entryFree id="n5589" type="main" key="botrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">botrus</orth>, v. botrys, I.</entryFree>
botryitis: <entryFree id="n5590" type="greek" key="bo_^try^i_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^tryītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">botrui+=tis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">botruw/dhs</foreign> (cluster-shaped), <sense id="n5590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of calamine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl>, n. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 24" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 24</bibl> and 220.—</sense><sense id="n5590.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone in the form of a cluster of grapes</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botryo: <entryFree id="n5591" type="greek" key="bo_^try^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^tryo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^trĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 14</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a parallel form to botrys, = <foreign lang="greek">botruw/n</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">bo/trus</foreign>, <sense id="n5591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cluster of grapes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botryodes: <entryFree id="n5592" type="greek" key="bo^try^o_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtryōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">botruw)dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n5592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a cluster of grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadmea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (4), 11, 1.</sense></entryFree>
botryon: <entryFree id="n5593" type="greek" key="bo^try^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtryon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/truon</foreign>, <sense id="n5593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine prepared from excrements</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 10, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botrys: <entryFree id="n5594" type="greek" key="bo_^trys1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^trys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bo/trus</foreign>. <sense id="n5594.0" n="I" level="1"> Latinized <orth extent="full" lang="la">bō^trus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 14</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">the grape</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Mic. 7, 1</bibl> (as transl. of the Heb. <foreign />).—</sense><sense id="n5594.1" n="II" level="1"> In the Greek form botrys, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> artemisia, <hi rend="ital">mugwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 36, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 11, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5595" type="main" key="Bo_^trys2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bō^trys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bo/trus</foreign>, <sense id="n5595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Phœnicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the village of Batron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bottiaea: <entryFree id="n5596" type="main" key="Botti^aea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bottĭaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bottiai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small province in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">whose inhabitants are called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bottiaei</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bottiai=oi</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl> (acc. to the same in Thrace).</sense></entryFree>
botularius: <entryFree id="n5597" type="hapax" key="bo^tu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>botulus</etym>, <sense id="n5597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sausage-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in sausages</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
botulus: <entryFree id="n5598" type="main" key="bo^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (orig. like <foreign lang="greek">fu/skh</foreign> and the Ital. budello, derived from the Lat.; Fr. boyau, an intestine; hence like the somewhat differently formed derivatives, Ital. boldone and boldonuccio; Fr. boudin; Engl. pudding), <sense id="n5598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sausage</hi> (very rare; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:7:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 7, 11</bibl>, a vulgar word, used by Laber. for farcimen): botulus genus farciminis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:72" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n5598.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stomach filled with delicacies</hi>, Tert. Jejun. adv. Psych. c. 1.</sense></entryFree>
boudicea: <entryFree id="n5599" type="main" key="Boudice_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Boudicēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bouducēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">queen of the Iceni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a British tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl> (al.: Boadicea, Boadica).</sense></entryFree>
boustrophedon: <entryFree id="n5600" type="greek" key="boustro^phe_do^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">boustrŏphēdŏn</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">boustrofhdo/n</foreign>, <sense id="n5600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from right to left and back again alternately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forwards and backwards</hi>, an ancient way of writing, Mar. Vict. 1, 14, 6 Gaisf. (al. boustrophen, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 2499</bibl> P.).</sense></entryFree>
bova: <entryFree id="n5601" type="main" key="bova1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bova</orth>, v. boa.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5602" type="main" key="bova2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bova</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling of the legs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum tumor viae labore collectus bova appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bovarius: <entryFree id="n5603" type="main" key="bo^va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">boār-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to horned cattle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva, afterwards the site of the Forum Bovarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">Forum,</quote> <trans><tr>the cattle-market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">horam sibi octavam, dum in foro bovario inquireret, postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Aem. Scaur. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:473" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 473</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 27, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; 35, 40, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:7" default="NO">2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lappa boaria,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of bur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 66, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIANTES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 913</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bovatim: <entryFree id="n5604" type="main" key="bo^va_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of oxen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cows</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 40, 25</bibl> (others read boatim).</sense></entryFree>
bovianum: <entryFree id="n5605" type="main" key="Bo^vi^a_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*boi+/a=non</foreign>, <sense id="n5605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two towns in Samnium.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5605.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The principal place of the Pentri</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Boiano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28, 2</bibl> and 3; 9, 31, 4; 10, 43, 15; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>, with the appel. Vetus, to distinguish it from, </sense><sense id="n5605.2" n="II" level="1"> Bovianum Undecumanorum, prob. <hi rend="ital">a place in the neighborhood of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupied</hi> <cb n="BRAC" /> <hi rend="ital">by the veterans of the eleventh legion</hi>, Plin. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvĭānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bovianum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 566</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: ager, Gromat. Vet. p. 259, 23.</sense></entryFree>
bovicidium: <entryFree id="n5606" type="hapax" key="bo^vi^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bos-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n5606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slaughtering of cattle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bovile: <entryFree id="n5607" type="main" key="bo^vi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvīle</orth>, v. bubile.</entryFree>
bovilla: <entryFree id="n5608" type="gloss" key="bo^villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvilla</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">boustasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cattle-stall</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
bovillae: <entryFree id="n5609" type="main" key="Bo^villae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvillae</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏbellae</orth>, Tab. Peut.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏbillae</orth>, Gromat. Vet. p. 231, 11), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 103" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 103</bibl>). <sense id="n5609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small but very ancient town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony from</hi> Alba Longa, <hi rend="ital">about twelve miles from Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Appian Way</hi>, and, until some time in the Middle Ages, the first station on it; <cit><quote lang="la">it contained the Sacrarium of the Julian gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:55 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 55 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:47:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 47, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:667" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 667</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2625</bibl>.—At an inn in this town Clodius, previously attacked and wounded in the Temple of Bona Dea, was murdered by Milo, Ascon. Cic. Mil. Argum. (4).—</sense><sense id="n5609.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5609.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvil-lānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bovillœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna, i.e. the killing of Clodius (with a play on the word bovillus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n5609.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvillen-ses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Bovillœ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 456</bibl>, n. 74; so Fratr. Arval. Marin. p. 654.—</sense><sense id="n5609.4" n="II" level="1"> Bovillanus fundus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>, is referred to <hi rend="ital">another place of the same name in the territory of the Arpini</hi>, otherwise unknown.</sense></entryFree>
bovillus: <entryFree id="n5610" type="main" key="bo^villus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a very ancient form of the class. bubulus [bos]. <sense id="n5610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to oxen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex, in an old religious formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5610.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bŏvillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = Bovillanus; v. Bovillae, I. B. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bovinator: <entryFree id="n5611" type="main" key="bo^vi_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bovinor</etym>. <sense id="n5611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brawler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blusterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviler</hi>, acc. to the Gloss.: bovinatores <foreign lang="greek">qorubopoioi/, qru/llon poiou=ntes h) taraxh/n</foreign>; v. bovinor.—</sense><sense id="n5611.1" n="II" level="1"> = tergiversator, <hi rend="ital">one who seeks evasions</hi> (the figure drawn perh. from the holding back of draught cattle), Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bovinor: <entryFree id="n5612" type="gloss" key="bo^vi_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvīnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>bos</etym>, <sense id="n5612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bellow at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>: bovinatur = conviciatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 12</bibl> Müll.: bovinator = conviciator, inconstans. Bovinari = conviciari, damnare, clamare, Vocab. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
bovinus: <entryFree id="n5613" type="hapax" key="bo^vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = bubulus [id.], <sense id="n5613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to oxen or cows</hi>: medulla, Theod. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Diaeta, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bovis: <entryFree id="n5614" type="main" key="bo^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvis</orth>, v. bos.</entryFree>
bovo: <entryFree id="n5615" type="main" key="bo^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bŏvo</orth>, v. boo.</entryFree>
bovus: <entryFree id="n5616" type="gloss" key="bovus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bovus</orth> <itype>non nisi singularem numerum capit, nam pluralem nemo dixit</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 58</bibl> (the signif. of this word, not used elsewh., is not given by Charis.).</entryFree>
box: <entryFree id="n5617" type="greek" key="bo_x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bōx</orth>, <itype>bōcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bw/c, bo/ac</foreign>, <sense id="n5617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 145</bibl>. In Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 6</bibl> Müll. (Jan. boca), bocas: bocas = genus piscis a boando id est vocem emittendo appellatur; cf. ls<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Orig. 12:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Orig. 12, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brabeum: <entryFree id="n5618" type="greek" key="bra^be_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brăbēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brabei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n5618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prize in the games</hi> (late Lat.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 538; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brabeuta: <entryFree id="n5619" type="greek" key="bra^beuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brăbeuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brabeuth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who presided at the public games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an umpire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who assigned the prizes</hi>: designatores, quos Graeci <foreign lang="greek">brabeuta\s</foreign> appellant, artem ludicram non facere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 1</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brabyla: <entryFree id="n5620" type="main" key="brabyla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brabyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 32, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bracae: <entryFree id="n5621" type="foreign" key="bra_cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācae</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">braccae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype> (once in <number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">brāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 34</bibl>; and as access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">brāces</orth>, Edict. Diocl. p. 20), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Germ.; Swed. brōk; Angl. -Sax. brōk; Engl. breeches; Dutch, broek</etym>, <sense id="n5621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trowsers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeches;</hi> orig. worn only by barbarians, i.e. neither Greeks nor Romans: <cit><quote lang="la">barbara tegmina crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 777</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the time of the emperors also among the Romans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 49</bibl></cit>: Galli bracas deposuerunt, latum clavum sumpserunt, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, <pb n="249" /> <cb n="BRAC" /> 43: <cit><quote lang="la">bracas indutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:227" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmaticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:424" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.; Cod. Th. 14, 10, 2; cf. Burm. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 518, and bracatus.</sense></entryFree>
bracari: <entryFree id="n5622" type="main" key="Bra_ca^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brācări</orth>, <itype>ūm</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of Gauls in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>.—Hence, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brācărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bracari</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CONVENTVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bracarius: <entryFree id="n5623" type="main" key="bra_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>braca</etym>, <sense id="n5623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of trowsers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breeches</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 20.</sense></entryFree>
bracatus: <entryFree id="n5624" type="main" key="bra_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n5624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wearing trowsers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breeches.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5624.1" n="A" level="2"> A gen. epithet for <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic existimatis eos hic sagatos bracatosque versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit> (11, 23): <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 4, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">turba Getarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 47</bibl></cit> Jahn: <cit><quote lang="la">Medi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5624.2" n="B" level="2"> As a geog. designation of <hi rend="ital">the land and the people beyond the Alps</hi>, = transalpinus, in distinction from togatus (q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia Bracata, afterwards called Gallia Narbonensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bracatis et Transalpinis nationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, sarcastically: <cit><quote lang="la">O bracatae cognationis dedecus (kindr. with the people of Gallia Bracata, through his maternal grandfather, Calventius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 53</bibl></cit>: bracatorum pueri, <hi rend="ital">boys from</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:234" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 234</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5624.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wearing broad garments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satarchae totum bracati corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bracchialis: <entryFree id="n5625" type="main" key="bracchi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brāch-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bracchium</etym>, <sense id="n5625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the arm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>the thickness of an arm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 27, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5625.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. ornamentum): <cit><quote lang="la">argenteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:82 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 82 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:129" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 10, 80, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. torques), Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14, 5</bibl> (class. armillae); <hi rend="ital">an armlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bracelet;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1220</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
bracchiatus: <entryFree id="n5626" type="main" key="bracchi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brāch-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id. II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n5626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with boughs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branches like arms</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:12" default="NO">5, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:13" default="NO">5, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bracchiolaris: <entryFree id="n5627" type="hapax" key="bracchi^o^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭŏlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brāch-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bracchiolum, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n5627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a muscle of a horse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bracchiolum: <entryFree id="n5628" type="main" key="bracchi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brāch-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bracchium</etym>. <sense id="n5628.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate arm</hi>: puellulae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5628.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5628.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A muscle in a horse</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s leg</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 4</bibl> and 5; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 27, 7</bibl>; 5, 70, 2.—</sense><sense id="n5628.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The arm</hi> of a chair or seat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 9, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bracchionarium: <entryFree id="n5629" type="gloss" key="bracchi^o^na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭŏnārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brāch-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ye/llion a)ndro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bracelet</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat. [<foreign lang="greek">braxi/wn</foreign>].</sense></entryFree>
bracchium: <entryFree id="n5630" type="main" key="bracchi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracchĭum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">brāchĭ-um</orth>; <sense id="n5630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> bracchi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 434</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">braxi/wn</foreign>; but cf. Sanscr. bāhu; like frango, Sanscr. bhang, Bopp, Gloss. p. 239 a</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the arm;</hi> particularly, </sense><sense id="n5630.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the forearm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the hand to the elbow</hi> (while lacertus is the upper arm, from the elbow to the shoulder), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 830</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 397</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia et lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 501</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 550</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">subjecta lacertis bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:29" default="NO">9, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(feminae) nudae bracchia et lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit> (opp. umerus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1, § 79</bibl> sqq.; 8, 10, § 55 sqq.—Far oftener, </sense><sense id="n5630.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5630.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the shoulder to the fingers</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 26</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:7, p. 4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 7, p. 4</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eum bracchium fregisse diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi ut diu jactato bracchio praeoptarent scutum manu emittere et nudo corpore pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium (sc. dextrum) cohibere togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium extra togam exserere): eodem ictu bracchia ferro exsolvunt (i.e. venas incidunt, as, soon after, crurum et poplitum venas abrumpit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41</bibl>.—Of embraces: <cit><quote lang="la">collo dare bracchia circum,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw the arms round the neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 700</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdare collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">implicare collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:762" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inicere collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:389" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervici dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentis adhaerens bracchiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 6</bibl></cit>: Hephaestionis bracchium hastā ictum est, <cb n="BRAC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in jaculando bracchia reducimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinisteriore bracchio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia ad superas extulit auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternaque jactat Bracchia protendens (Dares),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus horrida bracchiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>.—Of a rower: <cit><quote lang="la">si bracchia forte remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri bracchia tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrio tendens bracchia caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendens ad caelum bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precando Bracchia sustulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 262</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dirigere bracchia contra Torrentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to swim against the current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the movement of the arms in speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchii projectione in contentionibus, contractione in remissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extento bracchio paululum de gestu addidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissa bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a latere modice remota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bracchio exserto introspiciatur latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui transversum bracchium proferunt et cubito pronunciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium in latus jactant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contendemus per continuationem, bracchio celeri, mobili vultu utemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
