Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.5" n="3" level="3"> Of the motion of the arms in dancing: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia in numerum jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 769</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Ov.: numerosa bracchia jactat (ducit, Jahn),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2,4,29</bibl></cit>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 754</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 790</bibl>; imitated in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 22, 6; imitated in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 66</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the labors of the Cyclopes: illi inter sese magnā vi bracchia tollunt In numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.6" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: levi or molli bracchio agere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to do any thing superficially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remissly</hi> (prob. peculiar to the lang. of conversation), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">molli bracchio aliquem objurgare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">praebuerim sceleri bracchia nostra tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>lend a hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The limbs of animals analogous to the arms of men;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">the claws of crawfish</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 625</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 369</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>: hence also of <hi rend="ital">the sign Cancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 83</bibl>; also of <hi rend="ital">Scorpio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 195</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the claws of the nautilus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl>, and <hi rend="ital">other sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 258</bibl>.—Of the lion: <cit><quote lang="la">in feminum et bracchiorum ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.8" n="2" level="3"> Comicé for armus or femur (as inversely armus = bracchium): <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Edepol vel elephanto in Indiā Quo pacto pugno perfregisti bracchium. <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Quid? bracchium? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Illud dicere volui femur, <hi rend="ital">the shoulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the shoulder-blade of the elephant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 26 sq.</bibl> Brix ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n5630.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Objects resembling arms.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5630.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The branches of trees</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 550</bibl>: in ramos bracchia crescunt; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also manus and coma): vitem sub bracchia ungito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the vine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 368</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8" default="NO">7, 8</bibl> sq.; 5, 5, 9 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Mai, 2, 1: quatiens bracchia Quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differt quod in bracchia ramorum spargitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aesculus) Tum fortes late ramos et bracchia tendens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 630</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:114" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An arm of the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bracchia longo Margine terrarum porrexerat Amphitrite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The collateral branches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ridges of a mountain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus ubi bracchia emittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.13" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = antenna, <hi rend="ital">the sail-yards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet intendi bracchia velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 829</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:244" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 244</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.14" n="5" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">natural</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artificial</hi>) <hi rend="ital">outwork</hi> or <hi rend="ital">line for connecting two points in fortifications</hi>, etc.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ske/lh</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā parte consul muro Ardeae bracchium injunxerat,</quote> <trans><tr>a line of communication</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 52, 1</bibl> Drak.; 44, 35, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 30" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Afr. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:49" default="NO">49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:51" default="NO">51</bibl>; 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Hisp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:13" default="NO">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:266" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 266</bibl>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the side-works</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dikes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the fortification of a harbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:8:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 8, 5</bibl> Gron.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5630.15" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The arm of a catapult</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ballista</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
brace: <entryFree id="n5631" type="foreign" key="brace_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bracē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -em), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic name of a particularly white kind of corn</hi>, acc. to Hard. <hi rend="ital">blé blanc de Dauphiné;</hi> pure Lat. sandala, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 11, § 62</bibl> (al. brance).</sense></entryFree>
braceus: <entryFree id="n5632" type="hapax" key="bra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bracae</etym>, <sense id="n5632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to breeches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 74</bibl></cit> (others read braccica).</sense></entryFree>
brachile: <entryFree id="n5633" type="gloss" key="bra_chi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brāchīle</orth>, v. redimiculum. <cb n="BRAS" /></entryFree>
brachmanae: <entryFree id="n5634" type="main" key="Brachma_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brachmānae</orth>, ārum; <orth extent="full" lang="la">-māni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mānes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*braxma=nes</foreign> [Engl. Brahmins], <sense id="n5634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the priests and learned caste of the Hindoos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the present Brahmins</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Brachmanae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 42</bibl></cit>.—Form Brachmani, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 1, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Brachmanūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2</bibl>, n. 15 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 64</bibl>, mentioned as separate tribes or nations: multarum gentium cognomen Brachmanae).</sense></entryFree>
brachycatalectum: <entryFree id="n5635" type="greek" key="bra^chy^ca^ta^le_ctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brăchycătălēctum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">brăchy-cătălēctĭcum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1817</bibl> P.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. metrum), = <foreign lang="greek">braxukata/lhkton</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">braxukatalhktiko/n</foreign>; in metre, <sense id="n5635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a verse that wants a whole foot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">half a metre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 501</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
brachypota: <entryFree id="n5636" type="main" key="bra^chy^po^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brăchypŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">braxupo/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drinker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:15:120" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 15, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brachysyllabus: <entryFree id="n5637" type="greek" key="bra^chy^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brăchysyllăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. pes), = <foreign lang="greek">braxusu/llabos</foreign> (of short syllables); <sense id="n5637.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in metre, another name of the tribrachys, ˘˘˘,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl></cit> P.; Mar. Vict. 2539 P.</sense></entryFree>
bracicus: <entryFree id="n5638" type="main" key="bra_ci^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">braccĭcus</orth>, v. braceus.</entryFree>
bracile: <entryFree id="n5639" type="gloss" key="bra_ci_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brācīle</orth>, v. redimiculum.</entryFree>
bractea: <entryFree id="n5640" type="main" key="bracte^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">brattĕa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">bra/xw</foreign>, to rattle</etym>, <sense id="n5640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thin plate of metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold-leaf</hi> (thicker plates of metal are called laminae; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 18, 2</bibl>: bractea dicitur tenuissima lamina): aranea bratteaque auri, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 729</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leni crepitabat brattea vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspice, quam tenuis bractea ligna tegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 61</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argenteae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5640.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viva,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden fleece of Spanish sheep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5640.2" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thin layers of wood, veneers</hi> (opp. lamina): <cit><quote lang="la">ligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5640.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>: eloquentiae, Sol. praef. 2.</sense></entryFree>
bractealis: <entryFree id="n5641" type="hapax" key="bracte^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bractea</etym>, <sense id="n5641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of metallic plates</hi>: fulgor, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1024.</sense></entryFree>
bracteamentum: <entryFree id="n5642" type="hapax" key="bracte^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n5642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Contin. Virg. p. 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bractearius: <entryFree id="n5643" type="main" key="bracte^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bractea</etym>, <sense id="n5643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in gold-leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gold-beater</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1074, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4067</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, Inscr. Don. cl. 8, n. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bracteator: <entryFree id="n5644" type="main" key="bracte^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goldbeater</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 16; Inscr. Don. cl. 9, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
bracteatus: <entryFree id="n5645" type="main" key="bracte^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with gold-plate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilt</hi> (post-Aug. for the class. aureus): <cit><quote lang="la">sellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacunar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5645.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">glistening like gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>with a yellow mane</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 41:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5645.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. aureus, II.). </sense><sense id="n5645.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">O mentis aureae dictum bracteatum!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Gratian. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5645.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Shining only externally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bracteola: <entryFree id="n5646" type="main" key="bracte^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bractĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thin leaf of gold</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 152</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 355</bibl>; id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 49.</sense></entryFree>
bragae: <entryFree id="n5647" type="main" key="Bragae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bragae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island on the coast of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brana: <entryFree id="n5648" type="main" key="Brana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brance: <entryFree id="n5649" type="main" key="brance_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brancē</orth>, v. brace.</entryFree>
branchiae: <entryFree id="n5650" type="greek" key="branchi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">branchĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">branchia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 6, 4</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ bra/gxia</foreign>, <sense id="n5650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gills of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 18, 33, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
branchidae: <entryFree id="n5651" type="main" key="Branchi^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Branchĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bragxi/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n5651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the posterity of Branchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereditary priests of the temple and oracle</hi> (penetralia Branchi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:198" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 198</bibl>) <hi rend="ital">of Apollo at Miletus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:30" default="NO">7, 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Branchĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
branchos: <entryFree id="n5652" type="greek" key="brancho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">branchŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bra/gxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hoarseness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 95</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
branchus: <entryFree id="n5653" type="main" key="Branchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Branchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bra/gxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Apollo;</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">according to others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Smicrus of Delphi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspired by Apollo with prophecy</hi>, v. Branchidae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:479" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 479</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 198</bibl> Schol.</sense></entryFree>
brancosi: <entryFree id="n5654" type="main" key="Brancosi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brancosi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brasmatiae: <entryFree id="n5655" type="greek" key="brasma^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brasmătĭae</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bras-tae</orth>, App. de Mundo, p. 65, 25), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi( brasmati/ai</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)/nemoi</foreign>) or <foreign lang="greek">bra/stai</foreign>, <sense id="n5655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="250" /> <cb n="BREV" /> <hi rend="ital">shaking of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an earthquake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brasmatiae sunt (terrarum motus), qui terram molestius suscitantes sursum propellunt immanissimas moles, ut in Asiā Delos emersit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brassica: <entryFree id="n5656" type="main" key="brassi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brassĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cabbage;</hi> of several varieties (much prized by the ancients, and freq. employed in medicine), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:127 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 127 sq.</bibl> Schneid.; 11, 3, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:136 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 136 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:78" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 33, § 78</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jun. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 44 al. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl>, perh. a gloss; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">brassĭcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">varieties of cabbage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 187, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 37, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brastae: <entryFree id="n5657" type="main" key="brastae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brastae</orth>, v. brasmatiae.</entryFree>
brathy: <entryFree id="n5658" type="greek" key="brathy"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brathy</orth>, <itype>ys</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bra/qu</foreign>, <sense id="n5658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the savintree</hi> (pure Lat. herba Sabina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 61, § 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 154" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brattea: <entryFree id="n5659" type="main" key="brattea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brattea</orth>, v. bractea.</entryFree>
brattia: <entryFree id="n5660" type="main" key="Brattia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brattia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bratus: <entryFree id="n5661" type="hapax" key="bratus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bratus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree similar to the cypress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 39, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bratuspantium: <entryFree id="n5662" type="main" key="Bratuspanti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bratuspantĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">in the province of the</hi> Bellovaci, afterwards called Caesaromagus, Itin. Anton., now <hi rend="ital">Breteuil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brauron: <entryFree id="n5663" type="main" key="Brauron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brauron</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Braurōnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*braurw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n5663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Marathon</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vraona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:615" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 615</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breganticus: <entryFree id="n5664" type="main" key="Breganticus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Breganticus</orth>, v. Briganticus.</entryFree>
bregma: <entryFree id="n5665" type="foreign" key="bregma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bregma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">brechma</orth>) [Indian], <sense id="n5665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defect of pepper</hi>, = abortus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bregmenteni: <entryFree id="n5666" type="main" key="Bregmente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bregmentēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of the Troad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

brennus: <entryFree id="n5669" type="main" key="Brennus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brennus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bre/nnos</foreign>, <sense id="n5669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of the Gauls who defeated the Romans at the river Allia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 826</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brennĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Brennus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 561</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5669.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Gauls who invaded Greece in the second century</hi> B.C. <hi rend="ital">and attacked Delphi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 5</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 51.</sense></entryFree>
brentesia: <entryFree id="n5670" type="main" key="Brente_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brentēsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Brenta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Upper Italy</hi>, Messal. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Progen. 10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Progen. 10</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brinta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:677" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 677</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brephotropheum: <entryFree id="n5671" type="greek" key="bre^pho^tro^phe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕphŏtrŏphēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brefotrofei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n5671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foundling hospital</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brephotrophus: <entryFree id="n5672" type="greek" key="bre^pho^tro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕphŏtrŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brefotro/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n5672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings up foundlings</hi> (v. brephotropheum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Orell.</author> 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breuni: <entryFree id="n5674" type="main" key="Breuni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Breuni</orth> (erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brenni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Rhœtia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Upper Valley of the Inn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and bordering upon the</hi> Genauni, <hi rend="ital">in the Lower Valley of the Inn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breviarius: <entryFree id="n5675" type="main" key="bre^vi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>brevio</etym>, <sense id="n5675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abridged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 8, 26</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a summary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epitome</hi> (postAug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">summarium): haec quae nunc vulgo breviarium dicitur, olim, cum Latine loqueremur, summarium vocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis culturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>statistical view</tr>, <tr>statistics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl>: rationarium imperii; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes imperii): rerum omnium Romanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum omnium breviaria,</quote> <trans><tr>official reports</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl>; Eutr. tit.</sense></entryFree>
breviatio: <entryFree id="n5676" type="main" key="bre^vi^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shortening</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Hesych. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Hesych. 18</bibl></cit>: chronicorum, Jornand. Get. praef.</sense></entryFree>
breviator: <entryFree id="n5677" type="main" key="bre^vi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n5677.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An abbreviator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epitomizer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n5677.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The author of a</hi> breviarium (q. v.), Novell. 105, 2, 4.</sense></entryFree>
breviculus: <entryFree id="n5678" type="main" key="bre^vi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [brevis], <hi rend="ital">somewhat short</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnae, Fronto, Eloq.: grabatulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5678.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cb n="BREV" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. liber), <hi rend="ital">a short writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a summary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 7</bibl>, tit. 44, and Cod. Th. 1, 4, tit. 17 dub.—</sense><sense id="n5678.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 183, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
breviloquens: <entryFree id="n5679" type="hapax" key="bre^vi^lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>brevisloquor</etym>, <sense id="n5679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breviloquentia: <entryFree id="n5680" type="main" key="bre^vi^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>brevis-loquentia</etym>, <sense id="n5680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brevity</hi> of speech: breviloquentiam in dicendo colat, an expression of Cicero, censured by Seneca ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breviloquium: <entryFree id="n5681" type="main" key="bre^vi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>brevis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n5681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brevity</hi> in speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 754</bibl> P.; Fulg. Myth. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 561</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
breviloquus: <entryFree id="n5682" type="gloss" key="bre^vi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭlŏquus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-quis</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">braxulo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n5682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">short</hi> in speech, <hi rend="ital">speaking briefty</hi>, Gloss. Lab.</sense></entryFree>
brevio: <entryFree id="n5683" type="main" key="bre^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>brevis</etym>, <sense id="n5683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abbreviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">braxu/nw</foreign> brevio, Gloss. Vet. (post-Aug.; cf. Burm. Anth. Lat. 1, p. 76; most freq. in Quint.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 461</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviare quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid callide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 41</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixa (in scribendo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; Sev. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Hist. Sacr. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviatae horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. Nat. S. Fel. 24, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerorum raro decens allevatio atque contractio est. Breviatur enim cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non breviatis augustatisque gradibus ascenditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5683.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syllabam,</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brevis: <entryFree id="n5684" type="main" key="bre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>abl.</case> breve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <sense id="n5684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> breviore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 22</bibl>) [cf. <foreign lang="greek">braxu/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 26</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of small extent</hi>, in space and time (opp. longus; in space, in good class. prose, diff. from parvus, which designates that which fills a small space in length, breadth, and thickness; while brevis is used only of length in its different directions of breadth, height, or depth; and even of a circle, as merely a line, and without reference to the space enclosed, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. In poets and postAug. prose brevis sometimes = parvus). </sense><sense id="n5684.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space. </sense><sense id="n5684.2" n="A" level="2"> In distance, extent, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow</hi> (opp. latus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevior via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus brevissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevius iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu brevissimus Almo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi, quod lato non separor aequore, prodest? Num minus haec nobis tam brevis obstat aqua?</quote> <trans><tr>so narrow a stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 174</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also brevis unda, opp. latum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:19:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 141</bibl></cit> and 142: <cit><quote lang="la">non Asiam brevioris aquae disterminat usquam fluctus ab Europā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 957</bibl></cit> (strictioris, Schol.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 317</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevissima terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Euboico scopulus brevis emicat altō Gurgite,</quote> <trans><tr>a small</tr>, <tr>narrow rock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevibus Gyaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis In breve te cogi (sc. libellum),</quote> <trans><tr>that you are closely rolled together</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo brevius valent,</quote> <trans><tr>the nearer</tr>, <tr>the more powerful are they in conflict</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of the journey of life: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod in hoc tam exiguo vitae curriculo et tam brevi tantis nos in laboribus exerceamus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae brevis cursus, gloriae sempiternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum brevior dirae mortis aperta via est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—And <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of the thread of life: <cit><quote lang="la">fila vitae breviora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 46</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5684.4" n="B" level="2"> In height, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi> (opp. altus and sometimes longus); <cit><quote lang="la">of the human figure: sed sedebat judex L. Aurifex, brevior ipse quam testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statura breves in digitos eriguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) longa brevisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Vit. Hor.—Of a maiden changed to a boy: et incomptis brevior mensura capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 789</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of other things: ut pleraque Alpium ab Italiā sicut breviora, ita arrectiora sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>lower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevior ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1641" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus,</quote> <trans><tr>little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:574" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 574</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5684.5" n="C" level="2"> In depth, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shallow</hi> (opp. profundus): <cit><quote lang="la">puteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 570" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 570</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta\ braxe/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">shallow places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shallows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tris Eurus ab alto In brevia et syrtis urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 111</bibl></cit> (brevia vadosa dicit, per quae vadi pedibus potest, Serv.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 338</bibl>: neque discerni poterant incerta ab <cb n="BREV" /> solidis, brevia a profundis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevia litorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Perh. also in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit> Draeg. ad loc. (Ritter, brevia; al. breve litus).—</sense><sense id="n5684.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevia, in quibus volutatur, incerta, ancipitia,</quote> <trans><tr>difficulties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.7" n="D" level="2"> Of the line of a circle: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi circulus (i.e. arcticus) axem Ultimus extremum spatioque brevissimus ambit,</quote> <trans><tr>makes the shortest path</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of similar orbits, of stars: absides breviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. 15, 13, § <cit><quote lang="la">63.—Of the circular course of a horse on the track: discit gyro breviore flecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 314" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 314</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5684.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time. </sense><sense id="n5684.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (the usu. signif. of the word), <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5684.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto, nox, fuisti longior hac proxumā, Tanto brevior dies ut fiat faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve spatium'st perferundi quae minitas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 179</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 696</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Brevin' an longinquo sermone? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Tribus verbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis hic est fructus homulleis,</quote> <trans><tr>short is this enjoyment for little men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 927</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">MORS. PERFECIT. TVA. VT. TIBE. ESSENT. OMNIA. BREVIA. HONOS. FAMA. VIRTVSQVE. GLORIA. ATQVE. INGENIVM.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia brevia tolerabilia esse debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam vita brevis est, memoriam nostri quam maxime longam efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitae summa brevis spem nos vetat incohare longam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut omnia breviora aliquanto fuere, aut Saguntum principio anni captum,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied a shorter time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevissimum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breves populi Romani amores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis quom semel occidit brevis lux, nox est perpetua una dormienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:914" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 914</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 78, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores rosae,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly withering</tr>, <tr>short-lived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <trans><tr>frugal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus,</quote> <trans><tr>living but a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira furor brevis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio brevis atque concisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 441" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gratius quicquam decore nec brevius,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing is more acceptable</tr>, <tr>but nothing more perishable</tr>, <tr>fading</tr>, <tr>than beauty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 762" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:734" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 734</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.11" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5684.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> brevius, with <hi rend="ital">subj. clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shorter</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">easier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more convenient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevius visum urbana crimina incipi, quorum obvii testes erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: modo ne existimes brevius esse ab urbe mitti, Trag. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 40</bibl> (49), 3.—</sense><sense id="n5684.13" n="b" level="4"> In brevi spatio, brevi spatio, in brevi tempore, brevi tempore, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> brevi or in brevi, <hi rend="ital">in a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi> (before or after) (brevi tempore and brevi are class.; the latter, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)n braxei=</foreign>, to be considered as neuter, without supplying tempore): <cit><quote lang="la">inque brevi spatio mutantur saecla animantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 77</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in multo breviore temporis spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa brevi spatio simulacra geruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatio brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica per vos brevi tempore jus suum recuperabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ille affectus, brevi postea est mortuus,</quote> <trans><tr>soon after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit> (Zumpt; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to MSS. perbrevi).—So brevi post = paulo post: brevi post Marcellus Romam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: (Britanni) tantum usu cotidiano et exercitatione efficiunt, uti in declivi ac praecipiti loco incitatos equos sustinere et brevi (<hi rend="ital">in a short time</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">with great rapidity</hi>) moderari ac flectere consuerint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Herz. and Held.: <cit><quote lang="la">fama tanti facinoris per omnem Africam brevi divolgatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirantur tam brevi rem Romanam crevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi omnia subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 18</bibl>: scire in brevi, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.14" n="c" level="4"> Brevi, <hi rend="ital">a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little while</hi>: <pb n="251" /> <cb n="BREV" /> cunctatusque brevi, contortam viribus hastam in Persea misit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 32</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa brevi spatio silet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 307</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">* breve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.15" n="d" level="4"> Ad breve, <hi rend="ital">for a short time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad breve quoddam tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to things done or taking place in a short time; so most freq. </sense><sense id="n5684.17" n="1" level="3"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi> (most freq. in Cic. and Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">narratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl>: laudatio; <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensio et ambitus ille verborum erat apud illum contractus et brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 162</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 326</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc venio ad illa tua brevia: et primum illud, quo nihil potest esse brevius: bonum omne laudabile, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam falsa re! quam brevia responsu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 164</bibl></cit>: urbanitas est virtus quaedam in breve dictum coacta, Dom. Mars. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus brevem eloquentiam Menelao dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 64</bibl></cit> (brevis = <foreign lang="greek">ou) polu/muqos</foreign>, Hom. Il. 3, 214): <cit><quote lang="la">breviores commentarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annotatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevia illa atque concisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docendi compendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ut brevissimo pateat exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: commendatio, <hi rend="ital">requiring few words</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of a speaker or orator, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos imitatio brevitatis decipit, ut cum se breves putent esse, longissimi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevior in scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis esse laboro, Obscurus fio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eloquendo brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densus et brevis et semper instans sibi Thucydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvī</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in few words</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">brevi pro breviter M. Tullius de Orat. ad Quintum fratrem (1, 8, 34): ac ne plura quidem quae sunt innumerabilia consecter, comprehendam brevi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 176</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">id percurram brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit> Wund.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumscribere et definire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perscribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 26, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 47 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—So once in epistolary style: breve facere, <hi rend="ital">to be short</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid scribam? breve faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longum est ea dicere, sed hoc breve dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—Once, in breve cogere (diff. from I. A.), <hi rend="ital">to comprise in few words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into a small compass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in breve coactae causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in breve coactio causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:15" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— In late Lat. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. liber—acc. to another reading, <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕve</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>), <hi rend="ital">a short catalogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summary</hi>, = breviarium: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis nominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bonos. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 5</bibl>, n. 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n5684.18" n="2" level="3"> Of a <hi rend="ital">short</hi> syllable; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely as adj.: Syllaba longa brevi subjecta vocatur iambus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a brevis, gre brevis, faciet tamen longam priorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 86</bibl></cit> et saep.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. syllaba): <cit><quote lang="la">dactylus, qui est e longā et duabus brevibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:217 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 217 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fine pro longā accipi brevem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:86" default="NO">9, 4, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum habent celeritatis breves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 91</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence also once of a syllable long by position, but pronounced short: indoctus dicimus brevi primā litterā, insanus productā: inhumanus brevi, infelix longā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit> Meyer <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17</bibl> sqq., and Schütz Lex. Cic. s. v. brevis.—</sense><sense id="n5684.19" n="C" level="2"> For parvus, exiguus, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigua pars brevisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidia brevibus implicata viperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alecto brevibus torquata colubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi latere ac pede longo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">just before: breve quod caput, ardua cervix, v. 89, and brevis alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 80</bibl></cit> (on the other hand, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvae alvi): mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:574" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma (sc. pueri in stellionem mutati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 457</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So, lapathi herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit> (brevis = parva, non excrescens in altum, Schol. Cruqu.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia breviora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 26</bibl></cit> (minor corona, Schol. Cruqu.): <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 188</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">sigillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 73</bibl>: <cb n="BREV" /> vasculum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">offulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheris in candido breves macularum oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">nom. abstr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve in exiguo marmore nomen ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:72" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 935" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 935</bibl>.—So, pondus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 37 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕ-vĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">shortly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n5684.20" n="1" level="3"> Of space (acc. to I.) (rare): seu libeat, curvo brevius convertere gyro, <hi rend="ital">shorter</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a smaller circle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:94" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo brevius quam totus,</quote> <trans><tr>a little less than the whole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmatae, omisso arcu, quo brevius valent, contis gladiisque ruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n5684.21" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A. b. and c.) Of time, <hi rend="ital">in a short time.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5684.22" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">iratum breviter vites, inimicum diu, Publ. Syr. v. 249 Rib.: sapiens, cum breviter et strictim colore atque vultu motus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5684.23" n="b" level="4"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5684.24" n="(a)" level="5"> In expression, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in few words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed breviter paucis praestat comprendere multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1082</bibl></cit>: multa breviter et commode dicta (sc. <foreign lang="greek">a)pofqe/gmata</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl>) memoriae mandabam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem totam breviter cognoscite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 27, § 67</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 340</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim breviterque describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit> Beier <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter et modice disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 111:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 111, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 100</bibl></cit>;
