cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 632</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 783</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia soli Forsan Pacuvio breviter dabit (i.e. paucis testamenti verbis, quibus heres ex asse scribetur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 125</bibl></cit> Web. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 68</bibl>: beatum exiguis tabulis).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 1; 8, 6, 61; 9, 2, 16; 10, 1, 49; 11, 1, 5 al.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:113 al" default="NO">4, 2, 113 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5684.25" n="(b)" level="5"> Of syllables: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in verbis eae primae litterae sunt quae in sapiente atque felice, producte dicitur, in ceteris omnibus breviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brevitas: <entryFree id="n5685" type="main" key="bre^vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>brevis</etym>, <sense id="n5685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shortness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5685.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space (cf. brevis, I.) (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas angusti freti,</quote> <trans><tr>the narrowness of the strait</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:27:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus Gallis prae magnitudine corporum suorum brevitas nostra contemptui est,</quote> <trans><tr>smallness of stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec habilis brevitate suā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 82, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeplatani coactae brevitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n5685.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5685.3" n="1" level="3"> In time, <hi rend="ital">shortness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brevity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita diei brevitas conviviis, noctis longitudo in stupris continebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:141" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl></cit>; Sen. Brev. Vit. tit. et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: confer nostram longissimam aetatem cum aeternitate; <cit><quote lang="la">in eādem propemodum brevitate quā illae bestiolae reperiemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>.—But most freq., </sense><sense id="n5685.4" n="2" level="3"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">brevity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conciseness</hi>: si brevitas appellanda est, cum verbum nullum redundat, brevis est L. Crassi oratio; <cit><quote lang="la">sin tum est brevitas, cum tantum verborum est, quantum necesse est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:326 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 326 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:40:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 40, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tanta in dicendo brevitas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:19:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 19, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et a me brevitas postulatur, qui mihimet ipsi amicissima est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos brevitatem in hoc ponimus, non ut minus, sed ne plus dicatur quam oporteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Sallustiana brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO">10, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas quoque aut copia non genere materiae sed modo constant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO">10, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:8" default="NO">10, 5, 8</bibl>; 6, 3, 45; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 48: ea, quotiens causa poscit, ubertas, ea, quotiens permittit, brevitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem imperatoriā brevitate pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: est brevitate opus, ut currat sententia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2, prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, prol. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 10, 60</bibl>: brevitatis causā, gratiā, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of brevity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conciseness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 214</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5685.5" n="3" level="3"> Of shortness of syllables: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit numerus tum incitatius brevitate pedum, tum proceritate tardius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas celeritas syllabarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contractio et brevitas dignitatem non habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 193</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium longitudinum et brevitatum in sonis... judicium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5685.6" n="II" level="1"> For exiguitas, parvitas (cf. brevis, II. C.), <hi rend="ital">littleness</hi>, <cb n="BRIT" /> <hi rend="ital">smallness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusvis in brevitate corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 20, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
breviter: <entryFree id="n5686" type="main" key="bre^vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĕvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. brevis <sense id="n5686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bria: <entryFree id="n5687" type="hapax" key="bri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine - vessel</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ei)=dos a)ggei/ou</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 235</bibl>; cf. Hildebr. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 59</bibl> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 63</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hebrĭa</orth>: hebria est vas vinarium, unde ebrius et ebria dicitur).</sense></entryFree>
briareus: <entryFree id="n5688" type="main" key="Bri^a^reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭăreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*briareu/s</foreign>, Callim. Del. 143 (old form <foreign lang="greek">*bria/rews</foreign>, Hom. Il. 1, 403; v. Crus. Wb. of Prop. Names), <sense id="n5688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hundred-armed giant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called Ægœon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centumgeminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 287</bibl></cit> Serv. and Heyne; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 565</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 596</bibl></cit> Schol.: <cit><quote lang="la">immensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:596" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 596</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 167" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 167</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭă-rēĭus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Briareus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brietes: <entryFree id="n5689" type="main" key="Bri^e_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭētes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brigantes: <entryFree id="n5690" type="main" key="bri^gantes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brĭgantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of small worm in the eyelashes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5691" type="main" key="Bri^gantes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭgantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Brigantas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most northern and powerful people in Roman Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdued by Cerialis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:196" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 196</bibl>.—Hence, Julius Briganticus, <hi rend="ital">a son of the sister of Civilis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
briganticus: <entryFree id="n5692" type="main" key="Bri^ganti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭgantĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 70</bibl> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĕ-</orth>, Halm).</sense></entryFree>
brigantium: <entryFree id="n5693" type="main" key="Bri^ganti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭgantĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭgantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n5693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Rhœtia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bregenz</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl> and 3; Itin. Anton.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭgantīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>the lake of Constance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>, Lacus Venetus).—</sense><sense id="n5693.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The town of Briançon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in France</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brigiani: <entryFree id="n5694" type="main" key="Brigi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brigĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine tribe in Gaul</hi>, Inscr. <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brimo: <entryFree id="n5695" type="main" key="Bri_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brīmo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bri=mw/</foreign> (prop. <sense id="n5695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the angry one;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 170</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a name of Proserpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Brimo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:3:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 3, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
briniates: <entryFree id="n5696" type="main" key="Brini^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brinĭātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian tribe south of the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the modern Brignolo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brisa: <entryFree id="n5697" type="main" key="bri_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bru/tea, ta/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the refuse grapes after they are pressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grape-skins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brisaeus: <entryFree id="n5698" type="main" key="Bri_saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brīsaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sēus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brisai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n5698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 3, 12, 2.—</sense><sense id="n5698.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the poet Attius, <hi rend="ital">antiquated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 76</bibl> Coningt. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
briseis: <entryFree id="n5699" type="main" key="Bri_se_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brīsēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Briseïda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:189 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 189 al.</bibl>: <sense id="n5699.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Briseïdam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 106" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 106</bibl></cit>; <case>voc.</case> Brisaeï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 713</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brishi/+s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Hippodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Brises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and slave of Achilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom she was taken by Agamemnon</hi>: Varro, Sat. Men. 63, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
britanni: <entryFree id="n5700" type="main" key="Bri^tanni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtanni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Britons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Great Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 3</bibl> et saep.— In <number>sing.</number> Britannus catenatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5700.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Bretagne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Brittany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in France</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5700.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5700.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtannĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Brittānĭa</orth> in MSS. and edd. of Sol. and Mart. Cap.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brettani/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Great Britain</hi>, in its most extended sense, <hi rend="ital">consisting of</hi> Albion (<hi rend="ital">England and Scotland) and</hi> Hibernia or Ibernia (<hi rend="ital">Ireland</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 102</bibl>; hence, also, in <number>plur.</number> Britanniae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:42" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a more restricted sense,</quote> <trans><tr>the larger island</tr>, <tr>England and Scotland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:6" default="NO">3, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:102 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 102 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 3, 6, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 9 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5700.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtan-nus</orth> (Brītannus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1105</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">British</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> Britannicus): <cit><quote lang="la">esseda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:76" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 202</bibl></cit>; Laus Ser. 40 et saep.— </sense><sense id="n5700.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtannĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Britannic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">British</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>the British Channel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:1" default="NO">2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Rhenum et Sequanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl></cit>: legiones, Tac. <pb n="252" /> <cb n="BROM" /> H. 1, 9; 1, 60; 2, 57; 2, 65; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 22 al.: balaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: herba, <hi rend="ital">water-dock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumex aquaticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtannĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cognomen of the conquerors of Britain;</hi> of the son of the emperor Claudius and Messalina, previously called Germanicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 26</bibl>; 11, 32; 12, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">poisoned by Nero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>.—Of the emperor Commodus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5700.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Britto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brīto</orth>, <itype>ō^nis</itype>, = Britannus. </sense><sense id="n5700.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Briton</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5700.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An inhabitant of Bretagne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in France</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 21, 9</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 124</bibl> (al. Bistones).—</sense><sense id="n5700.9" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtannis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">British</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Britain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae, i. e. Albion et Hibernia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. p. 577</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5700.10" n="F" level="1"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtannĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Britannic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transacting business in Britain</hi>, Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, n. 177; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2029</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
britomartis: <entryFree id="n5701" type="main" key="Bri^to^martis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brĭtŏmartis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brito/martis</foreign> (Cretan, <foreign lang="greek">*b*p*i*t*u</foreign>, rich in blessing, and <foreign lang="greek">*m*a*p*t*i*s</foreign>, maiden, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11</bibl>). <sense id="n5701.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cretan nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Jupiter and Carme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventress of the hunting-net;</hi> when pursued by Minos, she cast herself into the sea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 285 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5701.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of the Cretan Diana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Stil. 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos Britomartis agit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 303</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brittii: <entryFree id="n5702" type="main" key="Brittii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brittii</orth>, v. Bruttii.</entryFree>
brixellum: <entryFree id="n5703" type="main" key="Brixellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixellum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixillum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 239</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Parma and Mantua</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Brescello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 51</bibl>; 2, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixillānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Brixellum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3734</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brixentes: <entryFree id="n5704" type="main" key="Brixentes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixentes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brica/ntai</foreign>, <sense id="n5704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Rhœtia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the modern Brixen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brixia: <entryFree id="n5705" type="main" key="Brixia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brici/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, now <hi rend="ital">Brescia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 32</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33</bibl> and 34 suspicious; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n5705.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5705.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Brixia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Brixians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1971</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5705.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Brixia</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">episcopus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 222" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 222</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Haeres. 41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Haeres. 41</bibl>: Brixianus).</sense></entryFree>
brixillum: <entryFree id="n5706" type="main" key="Brixillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brixillum</orth>, v. Brixellum.</entryFree>
brocchitas: <entryFree id="n5707" type="hapax" key="brocchi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brocchĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>brochus</etym>, <sense id="n5707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a projection of the teeth in animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brochon: <entryFree id="n5708" type="main" key="bro^cho^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brŏchŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gum flowing from the</hi> bdellium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brochus: <entryFree id="n5709" type="main" key="bro^chus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brŏchus, brocchus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">broccus</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">broncus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root bor-; cf. voro</etym> (ante - class. and rare). <sense id="n5709.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the teeth of animals, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit> Schneid.; 2, 9, 3.—</sense><sense id="n5709.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">with projecting teeth</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 25, 27 sq.</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. valgos, p. 375 Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5710" type="main" key="Bro^chus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brochus (Brocchus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 32</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
brogitarus: <entryFree id="n5711" type="main" key="Brogita^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brogitărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallo - Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of King Deiotarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom P. Clodius as tribune sold the office of highpriest at Pessinus and the title of king</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 56</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> Brogitari, <hi rend="ital">to denote a class</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bromatici: <entryFree id="n5712" type="gloss" key="bro_ma^ti^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brōmătĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">those who loathe food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 35, 6</bibl> [<foreign lang="greek">brw=ma</foreign>, edacitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>].</sense></entryFree>
brome: <entryFree id="n5713" type="main" key="Bro^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏmē</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏmiē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 182" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 182</bibl>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with her sister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought up Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bromius: <entryFree id="n5714" type="main" key="Bro^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<case>voc.</case> Bromie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 82</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bro/mios</foreign> (the noisy one), <sense id="n5714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Bacchus</hi> (on account of the tumultuous celebration of his festivals), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4,11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 132</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5714.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5714.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏ-mĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Bromian</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">Bacchic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5714.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Bacchus</hi>: Bromia auctumnitas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 71, 18</bibl> (but Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1006" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1006</bibl>, conj. Bromii); so, <cit><quote lang="la">remi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 365</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bromos: <entryFree id="n5715" type="greek" key="bro^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brŏmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bro/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n5715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:161" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 79, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bromosus: <entryFree id="n5716" type="greek" key="bro_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brōmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">brwmw/dhs</foreign>, <cb n="BRUM" /> <sense id="n5716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bromus: <entryFree id="n5717" type="main" key="Bro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bro/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n5717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur slain by Cœneus in the contest with the Centaurs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 459</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bronchia: <entryFree id="n5718" type="greek" key="bronchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bronchĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bro/gxia</foreign>, <sense id="n5718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bronchial tubes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:28:147" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 28, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
broncus: <entryFree id="n5719" type="main" key="broncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">broncus</orth>, v. brochus.</entryFree>
bronte: <entryFree id="n5720" type="greek" key="Bronte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brontē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bronth/</foreign>. <sense id="n5720.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Thunder</hi> (personified), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5720.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of one of the horses of the Sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brontea: <entryFree id="n5721" type="main" key="bronte^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brontĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bronth/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thunderstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>. —Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">brontia</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 15, 24</bibl> (MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">bronia</orth>).</sense></entryFree>
brontes: <entryFree id="n5722" type="main" key="Brontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brontes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Brontem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 4</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bro/nths</foreign>, <sense id="n5722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cyclops who labored in the workshop of Vulcan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brontia:
<entryFree id="n5723" type="main" key="brontia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brontia</orth>, v. brontea.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bronton</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brontw=n</foreign> (the thunderer), <sense id="n5723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1272</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
broteas: <entryFree id="n5724" type="main" key="Bro^te^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŏtĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brote/as</foreign>. <sense id="n5724.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by the Centaur Gryneus at the marriage festival of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 262</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5724.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Twin-brother of Ammon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with him slain by Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5724.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Vulcan and Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:515" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 515</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bruanium: <entryFree id="n5725" type="main" key="Bru^a^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŭănĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bryă-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brua/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n5725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bruchion: <entryFree id="n5726" type="main" key="Bruchi_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruchīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the royal residence in Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing the palace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">museum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mausoleum</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 15</bibl>; Hier. Vit. St. Anton.</sense></entryFree>
bruchus: <entryFree id="n5727" type="greek" key="bru_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">brou=xos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">brou=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n5727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of locust without wings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 22 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
bructeri: <entryFree id="n5728" type="main" key="Bructe^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bructĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<sense id="n5728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> -terūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brou/kteroi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a German people occupying the country between the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Lippe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Weser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105, 1</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bructĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 451</bibl>; and <pos>adj.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bructĕrus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bruges: <entryFree id="n5729" type="main" key="Bru^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brŭges</orth>, v. Phryges.</entryFree>
bruma: <entryFree id="n5730" type="main" key="bru_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for brevima, breuma = brevissima: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta bruma quod brevissimus tunc dies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 8</bibl></cit> Müll.: bruma a brevitate dierum dicta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 31</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 35, 6</bibl>; Gesn. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 106</bibl>; Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 28</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n5730.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the shortest day in the year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the winter solstice</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 746</bibl>; Varr. L. L. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa brumam serendum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:204 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 204 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis accessus discessusque solstitiis brumisque cognosci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:163" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 163</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5730.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5730.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the winter time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">musculorum jecuscula brumā dicuntur augeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimus dies brumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver proterit aestas, Interitura, simul Pomifer auctumnus fruges effuderit, et mox Bruma recurrit iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serite hordea campis Usque sub extremum brumae intractabilis imbrem,</quote> <trans><tr>even to the last rain of rough winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 321</bibl>.—So, horrida cano gelu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 443</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives illinet agris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per brumam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumae tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:89 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 89 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5730.3" n="B" level="2"> In the most gen. sense (pars pro toto), <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a year; plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:40:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:9" default="NO">10, 104, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brumalis: <entryFree id="n5731" type="main" key="bru_ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bruma</etym>. <sense id="n5731.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the winter solstice</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shortest day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 24</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <trans><tr>Capricorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexus,</quote> <trans><tr>the tropic of Capricorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:639" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 70, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasus, id. l. l.: meridies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>: hora, <hi rend="ital">the shortest</hi> (since it was the twelfth part of the shortest day), <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5731.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to bruma, II.) <hi rend="ital">Wintry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of winter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 95</bibl>: <cb n="BRUT" /> brumales hiemis menses (hiemis, perh. gloss; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">shortly after: etiam brumali mense),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <trans><tr>the short winter hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:7:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brumaria: <entryFree id="n5732" type="hapax" key="bru_ma_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūmārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [bruma], <sense id="n5732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> leontopodium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brunda: <entryFree id="n5733" type="main" key="Brunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Brundisium.</entryFree>
brundisium: <entryFree id="n5734" type="main" key="Brundi^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brundĭsĭum</orth> (in many MSS., but less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brundŭsĭum</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl> Torrent.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:576" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 576</bibl> Heins. and Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 20</bibl> Duker.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 609</bibl> Cort.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 104</bibl> K. and H.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brenda</orth>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33</bibl> Müll.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brunda</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 50</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*brente/sion</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*brenth/sion [*bre/ndon e)/lafon</foreign>, Hesych.; cf. Strab. 6, p. 432; Steph. Byz.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 1, 49</bibl>; from the harbor extending beyond the town like the antlers of a stag], <sense id="n5734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a very convenient harbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chief naval station of the Romans in the Adriatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and their regular point of departure for Greece</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Brindisi</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 478 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">redeuntes Graeciā, Brundisium navem advertimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:609 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 609 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5734.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brundĭsīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Brundŭs-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Brundisium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Brundisian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:63:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 63, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <trans><tr>taken in the harbor of Brundisium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 61</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brundĭsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Brundisium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:63:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 63, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Brundisino (sc. agro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
brundusium: <entryFree id="n5735" type="main" key="Brundu^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brundŭsĭum</orth>, v. Brundisium <sense id="n5735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bruscum: <entryFree id="n5736" type="main" key="bruscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bruscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excrescence on the maple-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brutesco: <entryFree id="n5737" type="main" key="bru_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūtesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n5737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [brutus], <hi rend="ital">to become brutish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 12, 24</bibl>; Ven. Ep. praef. carm. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
brutianus: <entryFree id="n5738" type="main" key="Bruti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brutĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Bruttii, II. B., and Brutus, II. B. 2. a.</entryFree>
brutidius: <entryFree id="n5739" type="main" key="Bruti^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brutĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name;</hi> esp. Brutidius Niger, <hi rend="ital">an historian of the time of Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of a work upon the death of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now lost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
brutinus: <entryFree id="n5740" type="main" key="Bru_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brūtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Brutus, II. B. 2. b.</entryFree>
bruttates: <entryFree id="n5741" type="gloss" key="Brutta_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttātes</orth>, v. Bruttii, II. C.</entryFree>
bruttii: <entryFree id="n5742" type="main" key="Brutti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttĭi</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brutĭi, Brut-ti</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brittĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bre/ttioi</foreign> Polyb., <foreign lang="greek">*brou/ttioi</foreign> Steph., <sense id="n5742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bruttii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the southern point of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 11 al.</bibl> —In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bruttian</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:570" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 570</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:10" default="NO">11, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5742.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Bruttii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Bruttiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Bruttiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Bruttios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 53, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5742.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5742.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bruttii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>the country of the Bruttii</tr>, <tr>Bruttium</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promunturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit> and 9: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 578" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:139" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix (prepared there, of the best quality),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 7, 23, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 14, 1</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Bruttia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:8" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5742.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Brutĭān-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bruttii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 141</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brut-tĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a class of servants to the magistrates</hi>: Bruttiani dicebantur, qui officia servilia magistratibus praestabant; <cit><quote lang="la">eo quod hi primum se Hannibali tradiderant et cum eo perseveraverant usque dum recederet de Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 26</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; cf. the expl. of the term by Gell. l. l. § 18 sq.—</sense><sense id="n5742.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttianae parmae dicebantur scuta, quibus Bruttiani sunt usi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5742.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bruttātes</orth> <itype>bilingues Ennius dixit</itype>, quod Bruttii et Osce <pb n="253" /> <cb n="BRUT" /> et Graece loqui soliti sint, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 488 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
brutus: <entryFree id="n5743" type="main" key="bru_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">brūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ba^ru/s</foreign>, perh. contr. from barutus, a lengthened form of barus, like actutum, astutus, cinctutus, versutus, from actu, astus, cinctus, versus; cf. also <foreign lang="greek">bri=qu/s</foreign>, heavy, weighty; Fr. and Engl. brute, brutal</etym>. <sense id="n5743.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwieldy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi> (rare): brutum antiqui gravem dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=31" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 31</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <trans><tr>falling down with heavy weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 105</bibl></cit>: tellus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 9</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra iners,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immota tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1020" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1020</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra semper immobilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Unde Horatius. Et bruta tellus): corpora neque tam bruta quam terrea, neque tam levia quam aetheria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5743.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5743.2" n="A" level="2"> Of men: <cit><quote lang="la">brutum dicitur hebes et obtusum ... Pacuvius Hermiona: et obnoxium esse aut brutum aut elinguem putes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 77, 31 sq.</bibl></cit>: fortunam insanam esse et caecam et brutam perhibent philosophi, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bruti nec satis sardare queunt, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. sardare, p. 322 Müll. (Bell. Punic. v. 65, p. 18 Vahl.): T. Manlius relegatus a patre ob adulescentiam brutam atque hebetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 66; cf. 2. Brutus, II. B.—Esp. in a play on the name, 2. Brutus, v. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n5743.3" n="B" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">irrational</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">a)nai/sqhtos</foreign>, Arist. Part. Anim. 3, 4) (so several times in Pliny the elder): <cit><quote lang="la">animalium hoc maxime brutum (sc. sus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29, 46, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:183" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 70, § 183</bibl>; 11, 39, 92, § 226.—But only late Lat. as a general designation of animals opp. to men, our <hi rend="ital">brute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irrational</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dumb</hi>, Greg. Mag. in Job, 10, 13, 23; 17, 30, 46 al.—</sense><sense id="n5743.4" n="C" level="2"> Of inanimate things: bruta fulmina et vana, ut quae nulla veniant ratione naturae, qs. <hi rend="ital">striking blindly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 113</bibl>: scitum Caesaris, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 66.—* <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. Magn. 3:67" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. Magn. 3, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5744" type="main" key="Bru_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Brūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*brou=tos</foreign> [1. brutus], <sense id="n5744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5744.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Junius, <hi rend="ital">the relative of Tarquinius Superbus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saved by his feigned stupidity</hi> [whence the name], <hi rend="ital">and the deliverer of Rome from regal dominion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:717" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 818</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl> saep. After him, Brutus was <hi rend="ital">the cognomen of the patrician</hi> gens Junia.—</sense><sense id="n5744.2" n="II" level="1"> From the plebeian gens Junia, </sense><sense id="n5744.3" n="A" level="2"> M. Junius, <hi rend="ital">son of Servilia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a half-sister of Cato Uticensis by M. Brutus</hi> (not <hi rend="ital">by</hi> Cæsar; v. Ellendt Cic. Brut. p. cxxvii.), <hi rend="ital">an intimate friend of Cicero about the</hi> 21<hi rend="ital">st year of his age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of the murderers of Julius Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:1" default="NO">2, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 9</bibl> and 10; 2, 12, 28 sq.; 2, 13, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a philos. and orator active and respected,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 9, 2</bibl>; Plut. <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:237" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; cf. Ellendt, above cited; Meyer, Fragm. Orat. 205. To him Cic. dedicated his writings: Orator, Brutus, de Deorum Naturā, de Finibus, and Tusc. Quaestiones.—</sense><sense id="n5744.4" n="B" level="2"> D. Junius, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-conspirator with the preceding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56 sq" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to him are addressed the letters,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 5</bibl></cit> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">12 sqq. al.—To these two Cicero's witticism has reference: quid ergo? Ista culpa Brutorum? Minime illorum quidem, sed aliorum brutorum, qui se cautos ac sapientes putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:717" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 717</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5744.5" n="2" level="3"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5744.6" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brūtĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> (<hi rend="ital">M. Junius</hi>) <hi rend="ital">Brutus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassianaeque partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum civile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5744.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Brūtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Brutus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">M.
